subject: Initial support for tls_priorities
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 06:39:08.000000000', 'message': 'Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

NB: cherry-pick needed manual adjustment due to missing context (i.e.
    we're not backporting podman support in rocky and queens)

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
(cherry picked from commit dbae8506927bf77ed430db138461d846e81a2489)
(cherry picked from commit 6aae98b3f1610745a40b0589a06c255abb9934e9)
'}]
commit_message:
Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

NB: cherry-pick needed manual adjustment due to missing context (i.e.
    we're not backporting podman support in rocky and queens)

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
(cherry picked from commit dbae8506927bf77ed430db138461d846e81a2489)
(cherry picked from commit 6aae98b3f1610745a40b0589a06c255abb9934e9)

commit_message:
DRAC: Fix a bug for job creation when only required

This patch fix a bug which creates configuration job on any
controller even if ``is_commit_required`` value is ``False``

Change-Id: I150fa02c75f5e228b3e18c24e9a101c2e1eb0274
Story: #2006562
Task: #36659
(cherry picked from commit fb83cfb76d2a83a6206fc7ea57d27e3ca08b9abd)

[{'created': '2019-10-08 19:54:30.000000000', 'message': "Exclude disabled API versions from listing

The code for listing supported API versions would return a static list,
whether those versions were enabled or not. This changes the logic to
drop versions that are not enabled so we don't report back support for
something that then would cause a failure if the user tried to use it.

Closes-bug: #1788039

Change-Id: I52c1264b3b67a5c1ea00de1c0de5bea04c3096ee
Co-Authored-By: iain MacDonnell <iain.macdonnell@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ae2bd6728f9f9cca30ff39582ca731e4b347d7f)
(cherry picked from commit 9ec5413effb5919a82a3f67f79c96f914f058508)
(cherry picked from commit ce5f48718d3bc650eb2fb7791f19cce5a8560185)
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude disabled API versions from listing

The code for listing supported API versions would return a static list,
whether those versions were enabled or not. This changes the logic to
drop versions that are not enabled so we don't report back support for
something that then would cause a failure if the user tried to use it.

Closes-bug: #1788039

Change-Id: I52c1264b3b67a5c1ea00de1c0de5bea04c3096ee
Co-Authored-By: iain MacDonnell <iain.macdonnell@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ae2bd6728f9f9cca30ff39582ca731e4b347d7f)
(cherry picked from commit 9ec5413effb5919a82a3f67f79c96f914f058508)
(cherry picked from commit ce5f48718d3bc650eb2fb7791f19cce5a8560185)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9b7f9a18202d50f06ab9398e1964b0044c5d3bc8

commit_message:
Make sure subports are unique when removing them

Neutron cares about subports of the trunk being unique. This commit
makes sure that is true when removing them by applying `set()` to list
of removed subports.

Change-Id: I6f55fe4e25e5956d758e7da84eb8eb172c8cd585
Closes-Bug: 1847287

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 11:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ports from pool do not reference deleted SGs/NPs

When a NP is deleted its associated SG should be deleted too.
However, when using pools, ports may have that SG assigned, not
allowing the SG deletion and consequently stoping the kuryrnetpolicy
associated object deletion -- which may cause kuryr-controller crashes
too

Closes-Bug: 1846717
Change-Id: I7ee071b32f08af567dd92bc6e081f2cb4a3b3366

commit_message:
Ensure ports from pool do not reference deleted SGs/NPs

When a NP is deleted its associated SG should be deleted too.
However, when using pools, ports may have that SG assigned, not
allowing the SG deletion and consequently stoping the kuryrnetpolicy
associated object deletion -- which may cause kuryr-controller crashes
too

Closes-Bug: 1846717
Change-Id: I7ee071b32f08af567dd92bc6e081f2cb4a3b3366

commit_message:
Allow horizon to be tested on metal

As horizon now can be configured to bind on specific IP and we don't
have haproxy on metal for now it's safe to run metal jobs for it.

Change-Id: I980c3ea822bf7e9e4599e244b8fc5f3940390fc1
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/681718

(cherry picked from commit 87b57dfe7113da09715d5613ab9c91c15a75c189)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Allowed Address Pair/Delete buttons are only visible to admin

Initially In Queens, when logging into Horizon in context
of a _member_ in any project, the "Add Allowed Address Pair"
and "Delete" buttons in "Network" -> "Networks" ->
<select a network> -> "Ports" -> <select a port> ->
"Allowed Address Pairs" are not visible.

When accessing the same panel in context of a project where the user
has the admin role, the "Add" and "Delete" button is visible and
functional.

This patch fixes the above issue by updating the policy_target.

Change-Id: Ia7db6c2881c72580a156eb97b11bb51f295cfbce
Closes-Bug: #1794421
(cherry picked from commit 87b57dfe7113da09715d5613ab9c91c15a75c189)

commit_message:
Remove networking-ovn python2 jobs

Python 2 will be EOL at the end of 2019. Ussuri will no longer support
Python 2 so it's safe to remove python2 jobs and save some CI resources.

py27 unittest tox target is kept because the job is defined globally for all
projects. We can remove the py27 tox target once the job is removed.

Change-Id: I38f5a382bf54c30361ccc93d5f565b2cfdd1d621

commit_message:
Fix inventory_dns

Dnsmasq does not re-read its config files on SIGHUP ([1]). Since
a config directive (host-record) is used, a service restart is
required in order for the record to be available.

[1]
"Notes
[...] SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration file."
  - http://www.thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html

Change-Id: I84ab94b6c1ae61fccc1b1aba5df52a000b1fa449

commit_message:
DevStack: Adapt `prefixes` processing

`prefixes` column for the subnetpools was also changed in
python-openstackclient 4.0.0. For better explanations see
I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37. This commit adapts our code
to new openstackclient.

Change-Id: I3f6ad0dcbc3da600029ecbe616f5cea6cf0f46cf
(cherry picked from commit 6d56ffc010a95ad32d58e50f3456681b276d67f1)

commit_message:
Add Allowed Address Pair/Delete buttons are only visible to admin

Initially In Queens, when logging into Horizon in context
of a _member_ in any project, the "Add Allowed Address Pair"
and "Delete" buttons in "Network" -> "Networks" ->
<select a network> -> "Ports" -> <select a port> ->
"Allowed Address Pairs" are not visible.

When accessing the same panel in context of a project where the user
has the admin role, the "Add" and "Delete" button is visible and
functional.

This patch fixes the above issue by updating the policy_target.

Conflicts:
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/ports/tests.py
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/tests.py

Change-Id: Ia7db6c2881c72580a156eb97b11bb51f295cfbce
Closes-Bug: #1794421
(cherry picked from commit 87b57dfe7113da09715d5613ab9c91c15a75c189)

commit_message:
Add Allowed Address Pair/Delete buttons are only visible to admin

Initially In Queens, when logging into Horizon in context
of a _member_ in any project, the "Add Allowed Address Pair"
and "Delete" buttons in "Network" -> "Networks" ->
<select a network> -> "Ports" -> <select a port> ->
"Allowed Address Pairs" are not visible.

When accessing the same panel in context of a project where the user
has the admin role, the "Add" and "Delete" button is visible and
functional.

This patch fixes the above issue by updating the policy_target.

Change-Id: Ia7db6c2881c72580a156eb97b11bb51f295cfbce
Closes-Bug: #1794421
(cherry picked from commit 87b57dfe7113da09715d5613ab9c91c15a75c189)

commit_message:
Relnote: default values are moved to openstack_dashboard/defaults.py

In Train release, we move most settings from local_settings.py.example
to openstack_dashboard/defaults.py. It is worth covered in the Train
release notes so that operators who depend on local_settings.py.example
can be aware of the change.

Also drops settings related to the operation log feature in
local_settings.py.example are as they are defined in
horizon/defaults.py (which is loaded by
openstack_dashboard/defaults.py).

Change-Id: Ib06925aef305ffa1545d10529acd42d04177f5e1
(cherry picked from commit d8d44de5d3bc8f4a9ac38557c16146a8493bb29b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-02 15:08:15.000000000', 'message': "Switch to ProcessPoolExecutor

Rather than using threading, we should be using processes to handle the
image upload processing. Currently when we're processing the images, we
end up being single threaded due to the GIL when processing the data. By
switching to the ProcessPoolExecutor, we eliminate the locking that is
occuring during the data processing as it'll be handled in each process.

Change-Id: I60507eba9884a0660fe269da5ad27b0e57a70ca8
Related-Bug: #1844446
"}, {'created': '2019-10-03 08:33:21.000000000', 'message': "Switch to ProcessPoolExecutor

Rather than using threading, we should be using processes to handle the
image upload processing. Currently when we're processing the images, we
end up being single threaded due to the GIL when processing the data. By
switching to the ProcessPoolExecutor, we eliminate the locking that is
occuring during the data processing as it'll be handled in each process.

Change-Id: I60507eba9884a0660fe269da5ad27b0e57a70ca8
Related-Bug: #1844446
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686353/
"}, {'created': '2019-10-03 23:13:06.000000000', 'message': "Make executor type dynamic

When we run the tripleo-container-image-prepare script, it performs
better under python2 when the process leverages a ProcessPoolExecutor.
Rather than using threading, we should be using processes to handle the
image upload processing. Currently when we're processing the images, we
end up being single threaded due to the GIL when processing the data. By
switching to the ProcessPoolExecutor, we eliminate the locking that is
occuring during the data processing as it'll be handled in each process.

Unfortunately, we cannot leverage the ProcessPoolExecutor when the same
code is run under Mistral. In order to make the code work for both
methods, we need to make the execution type dynamic. This change creates
two types of lock objects that are used to determine what type of
executor to ultimately use when processing the images for uploading.

"}, {'created': '2019-10-03 23:17:05.000000000', 'message': "Make executor type dynamic

When we run the tripleo-container-image-prepare script, it performs
better under python2 when the process leverages a ProcessPoolExecutor.
Rather than using threading, we should be using processes to handle the
image upload processing. Currently when we're processing the images, we
end up being single threaded due to the GIL when processing the data. By
switching to the ProcessPoolExecutor, we eliminate the locking that is
occuring during the data processing as it'll be handled in each process.

Unfortunately, we cannot leverage the ProcessPoolExecutor when the same
code is run under Mistral. In order to make the code work for both
methods, we need to make the execution type dynamic. This change creates
two types of lock objects that are used to determine what type of
executor to ultimately use when processing the images for uploading.

Change-Id: I60507eba9884a0660fe269da5ad27b0e57a70ca8
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
Make executor type dynamic

When we run the tripleo-container-image-prepare script, it performs
better under python2 when the process leverages a ProcessPoolExecutor.
Rather than using threading, we should be using processes to handle the
image upload processing. Currently when we're processing the images, we
end up being single threaded due to the GIL when processing the data. By
switching to the ProcessPoolExecutor, we eliminate the locking that is
occuring during the data processing as it'll be handled in each process.

Unfortunately, we cannot leverage the ProcessPoolExecutor when the same
code is run under Mistral. In order to make the code work for both
methods, we need to make the execution type dynamic. This change creates
two types of lock objects that are used to determine what type of
executor to ultimately use when processing the images for uploading.

Additionally this change limits the number of concurrent image upload
processes to 4 if using the ProcessPoolExecutor and caps the number of
threads at a max of 8 based on (cpu count / 2)

Change-Id: I60507eba9884a0660fe269da5ad27b0e57a70ca8
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
doc: link to user/availability-zones from user home page

This is a follow up to [1]. The user docs home page has a link
to the admin AZ guide but not a direct link to the user AZ guide
so that is added here.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667133/10/doc/source/user/index.rst@75

commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary operation of ovsdb and flows

Type of lvm.vlan is int and other_config.get('tag') is a string,
they can never be equal. We should do type conversion before
comparing to avoid unnecessary operation of ovsdb and flows.

Change-Id: Ib84da6296ddf3c95be9e9f370eb574bf92ceec15
Closes-Bug: #1843425
(cherry picked from commit 0550c0e1f66b26e7e947958fdddb60d8f309e76f)

[{'created': '2019-09-16 21:15:15.000000000', 'message': 'fixed_configured=True when Add/Remove port IPs

When updating a port with the fixed_ips request the
fixed_configured argument should be set to true when
calling _ipam_get_subnets() so that all subnets are
returned if host is not set.

Otherwise the ip allocation will be deffered and an
empty list of possible subnets for the port is
returned. Which in turn led to raising an error that
the network requires subnets to allocate an IP
address.

Closes-Bug: #1844124
Change-Id: I2e690ea0cf5fa0614e39be2b0e83afad3daa7f48

commit_message:
fixed_configured=True when Add/Remove port IPs

When updating a port with the fixed_ips request the
fixed_configured argument should be set to true when
calling _ipam_get_subnets() so that all subnets are
returned if host is not set.

Otherwise the ip allocation will be deffered and an
empty list of possible subnets for the port is
returned. Which in turn led to raising an error that
the network requires subnets to allocate an IP
address.

Closes-Bug: #1844124
Change-Id: I2e690ea0cf5fa0614e39be2b0e83afad3daa7f48

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 07:53:25.000000000', 'message': 'ovsdb monitor: handle modified ports

This patch ensures that the ovsdb monitor propagates the events
recevived for modified ports.

To keep it simple, we'll just add changed ports to the "added" list,
forcing the ovs agent to refresh those ports.

In particular, this will cover the situation in which the ofport
changes.

Closes-Bug: #1843870
Co-authored-by: Alin Serdean <aserdean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I0c3a570cbb3fbb03b4224744b32e034e9e255f8e
'}, {'created': '2019-09-13 09:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'ovsdb monitor: handle modified ports

This patch ensures that the ovsdb monitor propagates the events
recevived for modified ports.

We'll use a new list for the modified ports, which the neutron ovs
agent can handle using the same code path as the "added" ones.

In particular, this will cover the situation in which the ofport
changes. When using recent OVS Windows versions, VM ofports change
to -1 (invalid) when the VMs are shut down, receiving a valid
ofport when the VMs are powered back on (different than the initial
one). With this patch applied, "modify" events will be propagated
to the ovs agent, which will then update the OpenFlow rules.
The old rules are cleaned up by "update_stale_ofport_rules".

Closes-Bug: #1843870

commit_message:
ovsdb monitor: handle modified ports

This patch ensures that the ovsdb monitor propagates the events
received for modified ports.

We'll use a new list for the modified ports, which the neutron ovs
agent can handle.

In particular, this will cover the situation in which the ofport
changes. When using recent OVS Windows versions, VM ofports change
to -1 (invalid) when the VMs are shut down, receiving a valid
ofport when the VMs are powered back on (different than the initial
one). With this patch applied, "modify" events will be propagated
to the ovs agent, which will then update the OpenFlow rules.
The old rules are cleaned up by "update_stale_ofport_rules"
once the invalid ofport is detected.

Closes-Bug: #1843870
Co-authored-by: Alin Serdean <aserdean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I0c3a570cbb3fbb03b4224744b32e034e9e255f8e

[{'created': '2019-10-03 08:26:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "root_execution" lazy loading issue and refactor execution.py

* There's an issue with lazyly loaded field of WorkflowExecution
  model occuring on GET /v2/execution/<id> because the logic
  that calculates "published_global" of the execution rest resource
  hits "root_execution" field out of transaction scope indirectly
  within the "data_flow.get_workflow_environment_dict" method.
  This patch makes refactoring of this logic and calculates

* Other style change.

Closes-Bug: #1846152
Change-Id: Ic8609e55930e2ed13653e79e8ca7a31c951d9030

commit_message:
Fix "root_execution" lazy loading issue and refactor execution.py

* There's an issue with lazyly loaded field of WorkflowExecution
  model occuring on GET /v2/execution/<id> because the logic
  that calculates "published_global" of the execution rest resource
  hits "root_execution" field out of transaction scope indirectly
  within the "data_flow.get_workflow_environment_dict" method.
  This patch makes refactoring of this logic and calculates
  globally published variables of the workflow execution simply
  as its context that doesn't contain all internal data like
  "__execution" and "openstack".
* Other style change.

Closes-Bug: #1846152
Change-Id: Ic8609e55930e2ed13653e79e8ca7a31c951d9030

commit_message:
Delete glusterfs snapshot activate step

Back in the day, Activating a snapshot is needed to clone
the snapshot. But now snapshot is cloneable immediately after
creation. These are redundant and makes some errors on cloning.
Delete snapshot activate step.

Change-Id: Ia2972d67451a83183d1bfc7bb5c67410b7fccb12

commit_message:
Temporary allow to fail Trunk rally tests

We have stability issues with Trunk driver optimalizations [0].
In meantime neutron rally jobs sync has been merged [1] that
enabled Trunk scenarios.
Lets allow those rally tests failures, rollback [0] and in meantime fix it.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676182/
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664605/

Related-Bug: #1845479

Change-Id: Icf0f0f42f02180c787159fbd740b54316d5db997

Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I2da8f284b877edd2cf0e6f57352b616c54fabac9

[{'created': '2019-10-08 14:26:23.000000000', 'message': "DevStack: Adapt fixed_ips processing

Seems like python-openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way fixed_ips from
ports are presented, so instead of:

ip_address='10.0.0.89', subnet_id='99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472'

we get:

[{u'subnet_id': u'99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472', u'ip_address':
u'10.0.0.89'}]

This obviously sucks as the latter isn't even JSON, but so is life. This
commit fixes that by using python to parse this.

Change-Id: I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37
(cherry picked from commit 444096ea9650ab519a3f672f1f0edebec1c065fc)
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Adapt fixed_ips processing

Seems like python-openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way fixed_ips from
ports are presented, so instead of:

ip_address='10.0.0.89', subnet_id='99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472'

we get:

[{u'subnet_id': u'99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472', u'ip_address':
u'10.0.0.89'}]

This obviously sucks as the latter isn't even JSON, but so is life. This
commit fixes that by using python to parse this.

Change-Id: I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37
(cherry picked from commit 444096ea9650ab519a3f672f1f0edebec1c065fc)

commit_message:
Remove ovn specific logic for octavia

We probably should not have the ovn neutron driver specific
logic here. This deprecates and ignores 'neutron_driver'
parameter.

Change-Id: I9ba293d6a245ee875bf273d116baf64e44d0a554
Closes-Bug: #1839436

messages:
[{'account_id': 30955, 'date': '2019-09-30 11:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-30 11:37:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30955, 'date': '2019-09-30 11:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30842, 'date': '2019-09-30 12:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Remove Puppet upper cap

The bug is fixed in later versions so we dont
need to cap to this upper version anymore.

See [1] on how it was originally.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/commit/63737d7f89dfdb300463a630305642115be92b8a

Change-Id: Ife52b5986de15b6e34bff7f9dc7be2199efa5650

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 06:59:29.000000000', 'message': "[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
(cherry picked from commit 6906c4017fb1df525fd5b6c7eefb88e5c8b67ceb)
"}]
commit_message:
[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
(cherry picked from commit 6906c4017fb1df525fd5b6c7eefb88e5c8b67ceb)

'}]
commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I808e7e9594dc8bc178f1a5848d5ed72b1b1950cb

Thanks Jay Bryant'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-10-03 15:57:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think the release note concern is that peer persistence was added as a feature in Train by change I2d0342adace69314bd159d3d6415a87ff29db562 so since no one's had a chance to use it yet, this bug doesn't need to be called out and is covered by the previous release note announcing the feature.

I think since RC-1 has the feature *with* the bug, though, it's worth calling out the bugfix when we backport this to stable/train.  So I'm OK with including the release note when this is cherry-picked."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-10-03 15:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
3PAR: For Peer Persistence, add policy options in RCG

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1845483

For quorum witness to work properly, following options are
added after Remote Copy Group (RCG) is created: autoFailover,
pathManagement, autoRecover

Closes bug: #1845483

Change-Id: I9e975b526d469265b154a5b251844f3967a5e626

commit_message:
builder: allow to pass a dict to 'environment'

To allow to pass container environment as a dict instead of a list.
It's backward compatible, a list can still be passed.

We introduce a new function "list_or_dict_arg" so we can re-use it for
other parameters later if needed.

Change-Id: I85999889d3328dc9d2116b8539ac959b39cb833a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 18:11:15.000000000', 'message': "Use CentOS Storage Sig Ceph for RHEL8 scenarios

TripleO scenarios use Ceph packages from CentOS Storage Sig.
Having a RHEL8-based job of the same scenarios doesn't mean
you should switch Ceph packages to downstream RHCS4 beta RPMs.

Change-Id: Id13ff8bf1d896a039dc29e0db7d36d48c3186bff
Related-bug: #1841941
"}, {'created': '2019-10-01 13:27:55.000000000', 'message': "Use CentOS Storage Sig Ceph for RHEL8 scenarios

TripleO scenarios use Ceph packages from CentOS Storage Sig.
Ideally, having a RHEL8-based job of the same scenarios does
not mean we should switch Ceph packages to downstream RHCS4
beta RPMs. However, the CentOS8 Storage SIG isn't yet ready.

This is a hack to force the install of ceph-ansible rc16 from
the CentOS7 repo. Though binaries shouldn't work this way,
ceph-ansible is mostly a directory of playbooks so in this
case it should hold us until the the CentOS8 builds are ready.

Change-Id: Id13ff8bf1d896a039dc29e0db7d36d48c3186bff
Related-bug: #1841941
"}, {'created': '2019-10-01 14:51:41.000000000', 'message': 'Use custom ceph-ansible until c8 storage sig ready

TripleO scenarios use Ceph packages from CentOS Storage Sig.
CentOS8 and RHEL8 based TripleO jobs cannot yet use CentOS8
Storage Sig packages so use a temporary internal build as
a workaround until they are ready.

Change-Id: Id13ff8bf1d896a039dc29e0db7d36d48c3186bff
Related-bug: #1841941
'}, {'created': '2019-10-01 18:26:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use custom ceph-ansible until c8 storage sig ready

commit_message:
Use custom ceph-ansible until c8 storage sig ready

TripleO scenarios use Ceph packages from CentOS Storage Sig.
CentOS8 and RHEL8 based TripleO jobs cannot yet use CentOS8
Storage Sig packages so use a temporary build from rhel8-master
as a workaround until they are ready.

Change-Id: Id13ff8bf1d896a039dc29e0db7d36d48c3186bff
Related-bug: #1841941

Hmm, there's some difference in linkage to ceph-ansible from THT in the RDO and non-RDO runs?  In the non-RDO we see cephfs_data and cephfs_metadata_pool names set correctly in group_vars/all.yaml [1] and no failure at the  "assign application to cephfs pool" ceph-ansible task whereas in the RDO job there is no all.yaml file in the group_vars directory [2].

[1] https://storage.gra1.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_beb/682853/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-standalone/beb9227/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-urA9uz/ceph-ansible/group_vars/all.yml.txt.gz

[2] http://logs.rdoproject.org/53/682853/5/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-rhel-8-scenario004-standalone-rdo/fadb98d/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-y252_s1s/group_vars/'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-09-21 01:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I said "there is no all.yaml file in the group_vars directory" but I was looking at the wrong group_vars directory.  It's there and cephfs_data_pool has name 'manila_data' (not 'cephfs_data') and cephfs_metadata_pool has name 'manila_metadata' (not 'cephfs_metadata').  So the linkage from THT to ceph-ansible looks OK after all.

But the RDO ceph-ansible's version of "assign application to cephfs pools" has a bug: it is assigning the default values of the names of the cephfs_data_pool and cephfs_metadata_pool rather than the values set by THT.

Given the info from /var/log/extra/package-list-installed.tt, we can say that package [1] works correctly whereas this one [2] is buggy.

[1] ceph-ansible.noarch           4.0.0-0.rc13.1.el7         @quickstart-centos-ceph-nautilus

[2] ceph-ansible.noarch                           4.0.0-0.1.rc9.el8cp                                      @rhui-custom-deps'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-09-21 11:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 10:05:11.000000000', 'message': 'Run Manila in scenario004 without pacemaker

Scenario004 runs Manila with a CephFS back end and
runs the manila-share service under control of pacemaker
since that is the supported path.  However, there is a
need to test in a standalone configuration without pacemaker
deployed in CentOS 8, so here we fix scenario004 to run
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, and set it up
to run with the same privileges as it did when run as
a container-bundle under control of pacemaker in Step5.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705
Closes-Bug: #1841941

'}, {'created': '2019-09-18 20:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'Run Manila in scenario004 without pacemaker

Scenario004 runs Manila with a CephFS back end and
runs the manila-share service under control of pacemaker
since that is the supported path.  However, there is a
need to test in a standalone configuration without pacemaker
deployed in CentOS 8, so here we fix scenario004 to run
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, and set it up
to run with the same privileges as it did when run as
a container-bundle under control of pacemaker in Step5.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705

commit_message:
Fix Manila when run without pacemaker

The supported path is to run the manila-share service
under control of pacemaker using container bundles started
in Step5.  However, it is useful for test and POC purposes
to be able to run the manila-share service without pacemaker
control as a regular container started in Step4.

This change fixes the non-pacemaker deployment path, which runs
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, so that it uses the same
privileges for the manila-share container as are used for the
pacemaker-controlled container-bundle in Step5.

However. we do not change scenario004 to deploy manila using the
non-pacemaker path since in CI we want to test the path that is
supported for customers.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705
Related-Bug: #1841941
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685449

commit_message:
Disable overcloud image validation

To speed up CI and development process it would be better to disable
this script. CI will fail anyway even without this validation. Users
will be able to enable it if/when they decides to use tripleo-upgrade
for production upgrade.

Closes-bug: #1844567
Change-Id: Ia5a767491c2f297b396c5cc937c1495e4267a4e3

(cherry picked from commit 72dd2c49e37db7ed014f297e3b7aad8dc22f60fe)

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

commit_message:
k8s_atomic: Run all syscontainer with podman

Using the atomic cli to install kubelet breaks mount
propagation of secrets, configmaps and so on. Using podman
in a systemd unit works.

Additionally, with this change all atomic commands are dropped,
containers are pulled from gcr.io (ofiicial kubernetes containers).

Finally, after this patch only by starting the heat-agent with
ignition, we can use fedora coreos as a drop-in replacement.

* Drop del of docker0
  This command to remove docker0 is carried from
  earlier versions of docker. This is not an issue
  anymore.

story: 2006459
task: 36871

Change-Id: I2ed8e02f5295e48d371ac9e1aff2ad5d30d0c2bd
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazi@cern.ch>

[{'created': '2019-10-08 08:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Support TLS priorities for pacemaker

Introduce a PacemakerTLSPriorities parameter (which will set the
PCMK_tls_priorities config option in /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker and the
PCMK_tls_priorities variable inside the bundle. This, when set, allows
an operator to specify what kind of GNUTLS ciphers are desired for the
pacemaker control port.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

NB: cherry-pick not 100% clean (tiny conflict due to I0b2ae95563f64a21ef673e1e60889424a03fbc42
enable stonith deep_compare being merged in the meantime)

commit_message:
Support TLS priorities for pacemaker

Introduce a PacemakerTLSPriorities parameter (which will set the
PCMK_tls_priorities config option in /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker and the
PCMK_tls_priorities variable inside the bundle. This, when set, allows
an operator to specify what kind of GNUTLS ciphers are desired for the
pacemaker control port.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

NB: cherry-pick not 100% clean (tiny conflict due to I0b2ae95563f64a21ef673e1e60889424a03fbc42
enable stonith deep_compare being merged in the meantime). Also made
sure that the firewall_rules are expressed with '.' and not with '::'
(I6f67153e04aed191acb715fe8cfa976ee2e75878 is the change that happened
later which explains the background)

(cherry-picked from commit feee059a439e16f4bc179ea007567d05ef63220f)
(cherry picked from commit 62f6287a8f7594b589a548a5465d24af070f90f5)
Depends-On: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
Change-Id: I2a2ea8bfa4da35fa8721b14909b0968123379558

commit_message:
Add DHCPv6 rules + set ipversion for dhcp rules

Use the ipversion parameter for firewall rules to contain
rule creation in either iptables or ip6tables. Add rules
in ironic-inspector and neutron deployment template to
add rules for DHCPv6 in ip6tables.

DHCPv6 relay and DHCPv6 server both use port 547 so 547
need to be open for both INPUT and OUTPUT.

Related-bug: #1845153
Depends-On: Id872c55cfc6b958fef3ccda2d923f821a1fe6a13
Depends-On: I8b453f7c13c2015aa208ed1bddcdca246cdca58d
Change-Id: If91b883459488856ae54e3ca0d0fb97d4d248f97

commit_message:
Don't look for execution in payload

We don't seem to send the execution object anymore after
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630291/. Though we've
execution_id, it probably does not make sense to make
mistral api call to get the created/updated timestamps.

Change-Id: I11f500165026455d8d41fd07901357fc91d8a359
Closes-Bug: #1832511
(cherry picked from commit 7bd6a5206612f6d4818c891860e58d2281d0f27a)

[{'created': '2019-10-08 08:39:17.000000000', 'message': 'Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do

    we're not backporting podman support in rocky and queens)

Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435

commit_message:
Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

NB: cherry-pick needed manual adjustment due to missing context (i.e.
    we're not backporting podman support in rocky and queens)

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
(cherry picked from commit dbae8506927bf77ed430db138461d846e81a2489)

commit_message:
Collectd-sensubility

This patch adds parameters and logic for configuring
collectd-sensubility. Please note that privileged mode
needs to be removed so that container health check gets
smooth access to host's systemd data. We should instead
use --cap-add when some regression caused by missing
capability will arise.

Change-Id: I4422d25396e74f8b4b9980dc16386353bc6e4627
Depends-On: Ieb5042603ff76fd22f867a17a853bb1ec6a744f2

commit_message:
Don't look for execution in payload

We don't seem to send the execution object anymore after
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630291/. Though we've
execution_id, it probably does not make sense to make
mistral api call to get the created/updated timestamps.

Change-Id: I11f500165026455d8d41fd07901357fc91d8a359
Closes-Bug: #1832511
(cherry picked from commit 7bd6a5206612f6d4818c891860e58d2281d0f27a)

commit_message:
Don't look for execution in payload

We don't seem to send the execution object anymore after
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630291/. Though we've
execution_id, it probably does not make sense to make
mistral api call to get the created/updated timestamps.

Change-Id: I11f500165026455d8d41fd07901357fc91d8a359
Closes-Bug: #1832511
(cherry picked from commit 7bd6a5206612f6d4818c891860e58d2281d0f27a)

commit_message:
podman_container: command now accepts lists

If the command is in this format ['bash', '-c', 'ls'], it'll now work.
Before only 'bash -c ls' would work.
It's for compatibility with how THT generates container config.

Change-Id: Ib8e943f92b85adcde86d814268a97369b4317ec3

commit_message:
Use mirrors for functional test builds

Functional tests are currently not using mirrors during build.  Add a
template job to use the openstack-ci-mirrors element and update
functional tests.

This also exposed a matching error for CentOS 8 in the EPEL mirror
setup; update it to handle https URLs as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/685884
Change-Id: I8723588a27e8e667c78e5ae4e89c646d204c2a65

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic191a4511fb439438de0e045909738c7ac3eebc3

subject: Fix alarms get method return 404 not found bug
messages:
[{'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-05-11 07:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-05-30 11:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-05-30 14:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you! Are you able to add a unit test? Is the other branch of the if statement also affected?'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-05-31 02:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

on_get() method calls function self._alarm_show(req.uri, req.project_id, alarm_id).alarm_show function then calls function _alarms_repo.get_alarm(tenant_id, alarm_id).
in file sqla/alarms_repository.py,line 259.if alarms query return null or zero.then it raise a exception.

            if rows is None or len(rows) == 0:
                raise exceptions.DoesNotExistException

i only catch this exception.no other branch was affected.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-06-04 08:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Why is passing errors to users a bad practice? Could you give some reference? In contrary, I would say it's misleading to return the success code when it's not the case. Here respective Falcon documentation section [1] and HTTP status codes description [2].

I have run the following:

  # curl -XGET -I -H "X-Auth-Token: ..." -H "Content-type: application/json" http://monasca_ip:8070/v2.0/alarms/foo

and received:

  HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
  Date: Tue, 04 Jun 2019 08:16:12 GMT
  Server: Apache
  Content-Length: 0
  x-openstack-request-id: req-5f1c53b3-9074-478c-97f6-55b0297d1c6b
  Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8

Why is that problematic for you and what response would you expect? 

I think what we could do is to add more details in `title` and `description` of the error, similarly as we do it here [3].

We also should update the API spec about return codes [4].

[1] https://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/errors.html
[2] https://httpstatuses.com/404
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/src/branch/master/monasca_api/v2/reference/alarm_definitions.py#L224
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/src/branch/master/docs/monasca-api-spec.md#response-25'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think witek has a good point. I agree that 404 is the most suitable return code here, and that adding more info to the response is the best way of making this more user friendly.'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-10-09 00:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix alarms get method return 404 not found bug

If a user get alarm that not exist in database,then return a 404
not found error to user (if i use postman get the alarm that not
exist,then a blank page without any message except 404 not found).
This is a very bad design.Any erros or exceptions should not
forward to users.

Change-Id: Ia621e8fc3b05bdc1f0c628057f5dbeedd10c9431
Story: 2005648
Task: 30929

subject: Fix log level error
messages:
[{'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-07-12 08:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-07-23 09:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Actually after some testing I think this change should not be merged. The problem appear only in 3.4.1 as you wrote in story and we started supporting Python3 from version 3.5 so we never tested nor supported 3.4 version.

Also I think `logging.getLevelName` is useful in such way that it will protect against unknown log level (in Python 3.5 and higher).'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-08-15 00:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ok,very thanks.i thank community should consider many users running monasca not on docker evn ,they may run monasca on any python version.or use monasca images build by themselves like us.in producetion env,we still use monasca:python2.7,because it is a stable version(we find many problems after monasca switch to use python3).in our staging env,we use monasca:python3.4.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK, I understand your point of view but we never tried nor supported Monasca with Python 3.4. We don't know when more problems with 3.4 (especially older ones) could appear.

When you check for example here
https://github.com/openstack/monasca-common/commit/00bc2d4ccda4a938ca530e286b11688cd509e5e9
we started supporting Python from 3.5 

Problem also is that Python 3.4 already reached end-of-life
https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3410/

OpenStack goal for Pike was Python 3.5 https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/python35.html
3.5 in Rocky, and 3.6 in Stein.



Could you maybe use version higher than 3.4.1 in staging? Like 3.4.2?


This version (and higher) is working fine for logging:

$ docker run -it --rm python:3.4.2 bash
root@74264a2cbebd:/# python
Python 3.4.2 (default, Feb  5 2015, 20:47:45) 
[GCC 4.9.1] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import logging
>>> import os
>>> LOG_LEVEL = logging.getLevelName(os.environ.get('LOG_LEVEL', 'INFO'))
>>> print(LOG_LEVEL)
20


Problem is on 3.4.1:

λ docker run -it --rm python:3.4.1 bash
root@88fd2d4d32e9:/usr/src/python# python
Python 3.4.1 (default, Oct  9 2014, 01:22:42) 
[GCC 4.9.1] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import logging
>>> import os
>>> LOG_LEVEL = logging.getLevelName(os.environ.get('LOG_LEVEL', 'INFO'))
>>> 
>>> print(LOG_LEVEL)
Level INFO'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-08-20 00:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ok,very thanks.we will evaluate this issue and evaluate the effect of the higher python version.then test monasca-python3.5 in our staging env.'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-10-09 00:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

in the response of the following APIs.

- GET /servers/detail
- GET /servers/{server_id}
- PUT /servers/{server_id}
- POST /servers/{server_id}/action (rebuild)

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix security groups parameters

The security groups parameters are optional
in the response of the following APIs.

- GET /servers/detail
- GET /servers/{server_id}
- PUT /servers/{server_id}
- POST /servers/{server_id}/action (rebuild)

So fix them.

Change-Id: Icc2315fd8b8c085de9d560de6ddf4c05aaaf6acb
Closes-Bug: #1846656

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I25a0e5a30a745d2df6f47638ed93f697f94f01c1

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4e855655247ad00d3b0eccc6f8d79d31f3db7ba7

commit_message:
XStatic-*: Fix python3 package names

Commit d56c60e0dd7a01 moved the packages to python3 only but didn't
fix the package names. Done now.

NOTE(dmllr): Adding more cases.

Change-Id: I4b677ad2eeaa1864ac5bc1d9cf613cb35b54a177

commit_message:
PowerMax and VNX Manila - Read only policy is not working

Removal of '-' prefix which excludes the specified NFS clients from
ro privileges.

Change-Id: I2a395f99e0e533f8e8c91b345db4255ae6bdf72d
Closes-Bug: #1845147

commit_message:
CentOS 8 minimal testing and support

This adds CentOS 8 into functional and boot tests.

This completes centos-minimal support, documentation is updated and a
release note is added.

Change-Id: I435c2967b4f49faeb6d6edf189907b9f96e80357

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 13:38:23.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I39b3b137758b9c4942b8fd87a419783667f30389
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I39b3b137758b9c4942b8fd87a419783667f30389

commit_message:
Adds l3_extension_plugins to L3AgentContext ctx

* get a list of l3 plugins to enable based on relation data coming from
  neutron-api;
* refactor adding fwaasv2 service plugins to the l3 agent to accommodate
  the l3_extension_plugins change.

See https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/370
See LP: #1842353

Change-Id: Ic3a8e302942ed331bc3d80223e123c13d61db3b2
Closes-Bug: #1842353

commit_message:
Adds l3_extension_plugins to L3AgentContext ctx

* get a list of l3 plugins to enable based on relation data coming from
  neutron-api;
* refactor adding fwaasv2 service plugins to the l3 agent to accommodate
  the l3_extension_plugins change.

See https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/370
See LP: #1842353

Change-Id: Ic3a8e302942ed331bc3d80223e123c13d61db3b2
Closes-Bug: #1842353

subject: Add an option to enable port forwarding feature
messages:
[{'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-09-03 00:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-09-05 12:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the patch! ; comment nit only.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-09-06 10:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is a great patch Dmitrii, but I just realised it is a new feature and therefore requires a release not patch too.  So the policy for the 19.10 and onwards cycles is for features/enhancements to also get a patch on the release note.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:19.10-release-notes+(status:open+OR+status:merged) for more details.

Essentially, just a quick patch to the charm-guide and note it from here, and then this can land after the release-note patch is landed. Please let me know if I can help with this further.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-09-06 17:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I added a release note review: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680750

However, we will need other things to land such as the charm-helpers change, the neutron-gateway patch after that and a to-be-written neutron-openvswitch patch before we can mark this as complete.

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/370/files'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-09-11 11:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-09-11 11:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Alex Kavanagh (tinwood) <alex.kavanagh@canonical.com>
'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-10-06 17:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-10-07 15:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thank you for your work on this.  Absent a specification/blueprint for this feature, the main questions I have are around functional testing:

1. How will we prove that this works, and ensure that the next person doesn't inadvertently regress this feature?

2. Does tempest have functional test coverage for the neutron port forwarding feature which is being proposed?  We could use that as a point of validation if so.

3. As a last resort, can you do a write-up, including example bundles, demonstrating output of the feature and its functionality?"}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-10-07 15:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Re tempest - neutron-tempest-plugin has a port forwarding scenario test.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-10-07 17:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2) There are Neutron functional tests for this feature:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/579910/12/neutron/tests/functional/services/portforwarding/test_port_forwarding.py
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/574673/23/neutron/tests/functional/services/portforwarding/test_port_forwarding.py
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/533850/35/neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/extensions/test_port_forwarding_extension.py

A tempest test:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/aff03051e37530c823db7741d56834df6f52aa12/neutron_tempest_plugin/scenario/test_port_forwardings.py

The tempest test could be used as a way to avoid regressions to address (1).'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-10-08 08:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-10-08 17:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/HJqjBdx3zS/ (manual test on a DVR + L3HA router as the most complicated scenario)
https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/cdy3qJNZrZ/ (bundle)

Of note:

* floating IPs are "centralized" when port forwarding is used with them even though DVR is used for the deployment in general (i.e. they get placed into snat-<router-id> namespaces);
* the design is such that those FIPs are shared across multiple internal IPs with multiplexing done via ports - thus they cannot be distributed as SNAT is centralized;
* all snat namespaces (L3HA + distributed routers) or qrouter namespaces (L3HA + centralized routers) get iptables rules necessary for port forwarding to work. Thus when a router VIP migrates from one namespace to the other on failover there is no additional work to do to set up port forwarding;
* floating IPs are DOWN when they are created but transition to ACTIVE after a port forwarding is created for them (meaning they get placed into an snat or qrouter namespace).


I used Neutron API directly for the test https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/?expanded=list-floating-ip-port-forwardings-detail,create-port-forwarding-detail,delete-a-floating-ip-port-forwarding-detail#floating-ips-port-forwarding


This is because the CLI support was added recently and is not in Rocky or Stein  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650062/:
https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/cli/command-objects/floating-ip-port-forwarding.html'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-10-08 20:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-10-08 20:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-10-08 20:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1 Workflow+1

I made a minor readme update, needs someone else to review and land.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-10-08 20:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add an option to enable port forwarding feature

* Adds an option to enable port forwarding service plugin;
* Exposes whether port forwarding is enabled or not to neutron-gateway
  and neutron-openvswitch charms via the respective relation.

See LP: #1842353

Change-Id: Ic3a8e302942ed331bc3d80223e123c13d61db3b2
Closes-Bug: #1842353

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

commit_message:
Add NetworkManager and dhcp-client for CentOS 8

As described inline, NetworkManager and dhcp-client make up the basic
networking for centos 8 installs; bring them into the base image.

Although in infra we then use simple-init, some other users find this
helpful.

Change-Id: Ib9f32e73bf9109cc1b659fe1deceb1a15301ffeb

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3908676ddb54a774a5c5085f3acfe5a63efb176c

commit_message:
Fix networking for CentOS 8

By default network-scripts package isn't installed, so the directories
for these files don't exist either.  Skip by default for Centos 8.

Change-Id: I194ec3735e17f27e586386541dc51f775b01e510

commit_message:
Remove handling for client status races

Now that we guarantee that resources are UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS before the
stack update call returns for legacy stacks (this was already true for
convergence stacks), there is no need to have special handling to check the
updated_time in functional tests.

Change-Id: I1ebf38285746a090660044ffdb854e98b5f0dba0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589172
Story: #1669608
Task: 23349

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I101031ecb871845a031e6d11e6ca9b9ab70251ff

commit_message:
Remove calling enable_python3_package in devstack

The function was not used and was kept for backwards compatibility
in devstack [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/src/branch/master/inc/python#L143

Change-Id: Iddca055e07ba4a8bb9847871dffcb128f2c50c4f

commit_message:
Fix gate for enabling FQDN agent registration

If a new version of the charm is used to install a version of
OpenStack prior to Stein, do not enable the FQDN registration.

Change-Id: I64afa582cdfadafcd249ddfbeec267ba610d166a
Closes-Bug: #1846781

commit_message:
Ensure that the zuul home can be traversed

The default permissions for the zuul home directory
are not the same in the various distributions.
As /home/zuul contains the sources, a 700 default may be
problematic when accessing those files, so make sure
that the executable permissions are set.

Closes-Bug: 1846251
Change-Id: Ic9769e56274d7205844b86d3b5200a6415e4acad

commit_message:
docs: Highlight the current broken state of SEV

This won't be resolved in time for Train GA, so add a release note
highlighting the problem until such a time as the release is fixed.

Change-Id: Iae30e12084640d1c0f072d2db18653111988929e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1845986
Stable-Only

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 14:32:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix target branch for pbr and diskimage-builder

The target branch was centralized in change
I82aa19e739eeda3721bac1cb5153ad0bf2d1125a but there
are two issues, pbr and diskimage-builder are using
TARGET_BRANCH which gets changed to stable/* for
each openstack stable branch that gets created for
devstack, e.g. I861068ae1a9902cef61c52c70dda7bb42f4371a0,
but pbr and diskimage-builder don't have stable branches
so they should be using BRANCHLESS_TARGET_BRANCH i.e. master.

Change-Id: I47ac7a7e194ca6d613d0ccaebfd557346644c2df
"}]
commit_message:
Fix target branch for pbr and diskimage-builder

The target branch was centralized in change
I82aa19e739eeda3721bac1cb5153ad0bf2d1125a but there
are two issues, pbr and diskimage-builder are using
TARGET_BRANCH which gets changed to stable/* for
each openstack stable branch that gets created for
devstack, e.g. I861068ae1a9902cef61c52c70dda7bb42f4371a0,
but pbr and diskimage-builder don't have stable branches
so they should be using BRANCHLESS_TARGET_BRANCH i.e. master.

Change-Id: I47ac7a7e194ca6d613d0ccaebfd557346644c2df

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 07:06:23.000000000', 'message': "Exclude disabled API versions from listing

The code for listing supported API versions would return a static list,
whether those versions were enabled or not. This changes the logic to
drop versions that are not enabled so we don't report back support for
something that then would cause a failure if the user tried to use it.

Closes-bug: #1788039

Change-Id: I52c1264b3b67a5c1ea00de1c0de5bea04c3096ee
Co-Authored-By: iain MacDonnell <iain.macdonnell@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ae2bd6728f9f9cca30ff39582ca731e4b347d7f)
(cherry picked from commit 9ec5413effb5919a82a3f67f79c96f914f058508)
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude disabled API versions from listing

The code for listing supported API versions would return a static list,
whether those versions were enabled or not. This changes the logic to
drop versions that are not enabled so we don't report back support for
something that then would cause a failure if the user tried to use it.

Closes-bug: #1788039

Change-Id: I52c1264b3b67a5c1ea00de1c0de5bea04c3096ee
Co-Authored-By: iain MacDonnell <iain.macdonnell@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ae2bd6728f9f9cca30ff39582ca731e4b347d7f)
(cherry picked from commit 9ec5413effb5919a82a3f67f79c96f914f058508)

commit_message:
Stop hardcoding to use Cinder API v1

Starting with train, Cinder API v1 is no longer deployed, so we should
no longer hardcode it's use.

Change-Id: I31513b5d18ac1fdbf58d932d1ef132675a019e28

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: I01e882311877a2537397327560c7669a9005dd0b

subject: Change EAFP to LBYL style in nested transaction
messages:
[{'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-10-03 14:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-10-04 06:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-10-04 12:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-10-04 17:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-10-08 16:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-03 14:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Change EAFP to LBYL style in nested transaction

There is a side effect that KeyError when looking up for existing
transaction stores a traceback to Python system. Later, if transaction
fails and another exception is raised, the final traceback contains also
the original KeyError. Changing from EAFP [1] to LBYL [2] style avoids
this side-effect.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.4/glossary.html#term-eafp
[2] https://docs.python.org/3.4/glossary.html#term-lbyl

Change-Id: I30125ee023dfa59c4a5dde37195109e379e55c4b
'}]
commit_message:
Change EAFP to LBYL style in nested transaction

There is a side effect that KeyError when looking up for existing
transaction stores a traceback to Python system. Later, if transaction
fails and another exception is raised, the final traceback contains also
the original KeyError. Changing from EAFP [1] to LBYL [2] style avoids
this side-effect.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.4/glossary.html#term-eafp
[2] https://docs.python.org/3.4/glossary.html#term-lbyl

Change-Id: I30125ee023dfa59c4a5dde37195109e379e55c4b

commit_message:
Update the Gerrit server name in VMT process

OpenDev's Gerrit server has been moved to review.opendev.org so we
should use the canonical name in our process documentation rather
than the old compatibility redirect (but we can leave it as-is for
already created advisories).

Change-Id: Id7dcc90bf8fb6cbdd6103483befa9840b4754cfb

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I219a6deb703a4bda8b07e9deaab0450604684331

Yeah, this seems like a thing we should merge regardless.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-04 15:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-10-04 15:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-04 15:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I got mysqld logs published in the grenade jobs and it's pretty clear that we're starting mysqld 3 times in the grenade run, which 2 I can understand because old and new devstack don't know they are in a grenade context and will (re)start grenade at least twice, but I'm not sure where the 3rd start is coming from. If we're using bionic nodes on both the old and new side I don't think we'd be upgrading mysqld packages but I need to confirm.

In one recent failure this is where things start to go south in the mysqld logs and that's around the time we hit the cell timeout failures:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/4085120e390f4f1e971c6ff61304a596/log/logs/mysql/error.txt.gz#213"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-04 18:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-04 18:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I checked and the nova-multi-cell job failure in the gate was due to bug 1808010.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-10-04 19:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Log CellTimeout traceback in scatter_gather_cells

When a call to a cell in scatter_gather_cells times out
we log a warning and set the did_not_respond_sentinel for
that cell but it would be useful if we logged the traceback
with the warning for debugging where the call is happening.

Change-Id: I8f4069474a3955eea6c967d3090f2960e739224c
Related-Bug: #1844929

commit_message:
Add missing role name to Host prep steps task

The role name was missing from the task name, so the debug task that
refers to the task name was incorrect. This patch adds the name so that
--start-at-task can be used with Host prep steps for a specific
role.

Change-Id: Ie0888d5d075f0fae528bc4c71482246d334632ef

commit_message:
Add parameters for dateext in logrotate

I798304a472df41b86a88611c97c2c99131faa0ad introduces
a support of dateext, dateformat and dateyesterday for containerized
logrotate. To use those paramters from T-H-T, this change introduces
3 parameters, LogrotateDateExt, LogrotateDateFormat and
LogrotateDateYesterday.

 Conflicts:
	docker/services/logrotate-crond.yaml

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669604/
Change-Id: I5156199c7ebb5867be8b38ab6441a010ba3d29f5
(cherry picked from commit ce1c8d139641af8e8e86cfc64b9749a9e759a167)

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6

In case when this test is run on host with disabled support

"}]
commit_message:
[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
(cherry picked from commit 6906c4017fb1df525fd5b6c7eefb88e5c8b67ceb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 16:25:38.000000000', 'message': 'Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443
(cherry picked from commit d41bd58f31e259fe408c8c059b31299fdfe81127)
(cherry picked from commit 3a2842bdd8d8d59e445393c7c7e7a9793357df08)
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443
(cherry picked from commit d41bd58f31e259fe408c8c059b31299fdfe81127)
(cherry picked from commit 3a2842bdd8d8d59e445393c7c7e7a9793357df08)

commit_message:
Fix gate for enabling FQDN agent registration

If a new version of the charm is used to install a version of
OpenStack prior to Stein, do not enable the FQDN registration.

Change-Id: Ib86d6a48ee34c9efc42b4455ac669ef0cb8dc3bb
Closes-Bug: #1846781

commit_message:
Add train support for centosci

Wee need to add the release file for train at centosci same we do for
stein.

Closes-Bug: #1847217
Change-Id: I00f8f98e4ee2b3fc807af2946198ab863d38ab0d

You are not properly setting the "principal" for a few of the certs, which results in certmonger failures when TLS is configured.'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2019-09-13 19:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2019-09-14 00:45:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Comment for reviewers - a RDO CI failure for the tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp_1supp-featureset039 job (which tests internal TLS) was introduced by the recently merged patch that this depends-on.  This patch is needed to resolve that CI failure, as the failure is that the OVN DB cert/key/ca files don't exist when puppet checks for them when internal TLS is enabled.  This patch generates the missing cert/key/ca files.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674849"}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2019-09-14 00:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-16 06:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
Support connecting OVN DB over SSL

This patch introduce parameters which support using SSL to connect to
OVN_Northbound DB and OVN_Southbound DB.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683916/
Change-Id: Ib36a1b85ee33d1d06d14eaa323eba3e0f9b20f47
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 09:53:33.000000000', 'message': 'Disable overcloud image validation

To speed up CI and development process it would be better to disable
this script. CI will fail anyway even without this validation. Users
will be able to enable it if/when they decides to use tripleo-upgrade
for production upgrade.

Closes-bug: #1844567
Change-Id: Ia5a767491c2f297b396c5cc937c1495e4267a4e3
'}]
commit_message:
Disable overcloud image validation

To speed up CI and development process it would be better to disable
this script. CI will fail anyway even without this validation. Users
will be able to enable it if/when they decides to use tripleo-upgrade
for production upgrade.

Closes-bug: #1844567
Change-Id: Ia5a767491c2f297b396c5cc937c1495e4267a4e3

messages: [{'account_id': 30537, 'date': '2019-10-08 01:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-10-08 14:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 01:09:36.000000000', 'message': "we don't have to run completely the same test.

There are 2 workloads in CinderVolumes.create_and_restore_volume_backup tests.
However the 2 scenarios are the same.

we don't have to run tests if the tests are completely the same.

In 1st test, we will delete volume_backup. so do_delete property(line 631) should be set as True.
On the other hand, we will not delete volume_backup. so do_delete property(line 644) should be set as False.

Change-Id: I2f269faef4118a87fff1ebb5c27ac4957585f49d
"}]
commit_message:
we don't have to run completely the same test.

There are 2 workloads in CinderVolumes.create_and_restore_volume_backup tests.
However the 2 scenarios are the same.

we don't have to run tests if the tests are completely the same.

In 1st test, we will delete volume_backup. so do_delete property(line 631) should be set as True.
On the other hand, we will not delete volume_backup. so do_delete property(line 644) should be set as False.

Change-Id: I2f269faef4118a87fff1ebb5c27ac4957585f49d

commit_message:
compute: refactor volume bdm rollback error handling

Previously any exception while rolling back the connection_info and
attachment_id of volume bdms would result in the overall attempt to
rollback a LM failing. This change refactors this specific bdm rollback
logic into two self contained methods that ignore by default errors
where possible to allow the LM rollback attempt to continue.

Change-Id: I6bc73e8c8f98d9955f33f309beb8a7c56981b553

commit_message:
nova-net: Stop mocking the instance network cache

This has been tying us to nova-network. This should be a one line change
but it has a large knock-on effect due to lots of samples using it. We
just need to suck it up and deal with it, unfortunately.

Change-Id: I09c88e0fdf3635683c56901637fc3c0a9084d482
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 17:50:53.000000000', 'message': "trivial: Change name of network provided by NeutronFixture

We do this because most of our sample tests are currently using a fake
network cache due to 'stub_compute_with_ips', and that fake cache uses
the name 'private' instead of 'private-network'. When we remove that in
a future change, there's going to be a lot of refactoring. Head some of
that off by just using the same name.

Change-Id: I6339005a0d49a6dfd376523d3f9e145a00cfc3bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
