the name 'private' instead of 'private-network'. When we remove that in
a future change, there's going to be a lot of refactoring. Head some of
that off by just using the same name.

Change-Id: I6339005a0d49a6dfd376523d3f9e145a00cfc3bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
trivial: Change name of network provided by NeutronFixture

We do this because most of our sample tests are currently using a fake
network cache due to 'stub_compute_with_ips', and that fake cache uses
the name 'private' instead of 'private-network'. When we remove that in
a future change, there's going to be a lot of refactoring. Head some of
that off by just using the same name.

Change-Id: I6339005a0d49a6dfd376523d3f9e145a00cfc3bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Remove a whole load of unused images, most remainder

Thank God. The majority of the removed images are so crufty, it's
actually funny. I don't want to update them and it's unlikely anyone
else does either. The rest are just moved to be with their comrades in
the '_static/images' directory.

Change-Id: I91b34c85379a68be5e6a09ce48b11c0d3343f12b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I32421d2171ca440ba9c68491f7ea9a016439602f

commit_message:
Optional flag file for tripleo-transfer to prevent overwriting

When using tripleo-transfer role, optionally a file will be created at
a path specified by tripleo_tranfer_flag_file variable (if set). The
transfer will be prevented in case the file already exists. This is to
ensure the data transfer happens only once and the data is not
overwritten by accident.

Additionally, the README.md file from the tripleo-transfer role is
removed because tripleo-ansible docs are generated by molecule and
this file is not used there.

Change-Id: I3a08949436dcb634df34622c9aeead552dd38443

[{'created': '2019-09-18 08:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997

commit_message:
Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08
(cherry picked from commit 726b06cdb49426719a13be3f02bcce72a697484c)

commit_message:
Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08

commit_message:
Allow VIP resource to have customized ops

Introduce meta_params and op_params which will be
passed to the pcs resource create comand when creating
the VIPs. This allows us to specify custom ops for VIPs
in the following manner, by setting hiera. E.g.:
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::haproxy_bundle::op_params: 'start timeout=200s stop timeout=200s monitor timeout=5s'

Change-Id: I9a1c700051fc6dfc302e1d94347df2956442354e
Depends-On: Iadf0cd3805f72141563707f43130945c9d362f5c
Related-Bug: #1719540
(cherry picked from commit 8975100f773a2dcfdc39eaf6e979a763dae82866)
(cherry picked from commit 27b0847c54f536950be2aaa210ff6a036a3e5fc5)

commit_message:
Allow VIP resource to have customized ops

Introduce meta_params and op_params which will be
passed to the pcs resource create comand when creating
the VIPs. This allows us to specify custom ops for VIPs
in the following manner, by setting hiera. E.g.:
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::haproxy_bundle::op_params: 'start timeout=200s stop timeout=200s monitor timeout=5s'

Change-Id: I9a1c700051fc6dfc302e1d94347df2956442354e
Depends-On: Iadf0cd3805f72141563707f43130945c9d362f5c
Related-Bug: #1719540
(cherry picked from commit 8975100f773a2dcfdc39eaf6e979a763dae82866)

commit_message:
Make sure the wsgi script dir mode is 0755

When the system-wide umask setting is more restrictive than the
default setting, the wsgi script directory permissions may not allow
the apache process to access them, resulting in errors.

A similar fix was applied to Keystone some time ago, see [1].

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/4f15fb64b1cb60388efbee75acbfb3b13a8fa1f6




Change-Id: Ie9769657dc530bc895a3119b3e458864a8b5f293
(cherry picked from commit 33b05434f3e17f394ec1a39959adcfd46d361e06)
(cherry picked from commit e2e70bb6b927944e8dc3dd2ea587257055953fa5)

commit_message:
Fix domain name in install doc (2)

Commit 3f1a89c7dd34c53d5bc9f1190e48ac3a9320bc70 changed most of the
install docs to use "Default" instead of "default" for project/user
domain names according to the keystone docs, but the install doc for
PyPI has been missed. This patch fixes it accordingly.

Change-Id: I2e92730ff5819bf49cf1b286356870fdb9c6ece5
Story: #2006652
Task: #36894
(cherry picked from commit 81da427b337112769e327d550efd4227b11364ff)

The --skip-locks flag can be used along with --migrate in
deployments where table locking operations can't be performed.
For example, Percona XtraDB Cluster only has experimental support
for explicit table locking operations and attempts to use locking
will result in errors when PXC Strict Mode is set to ENFORCING.

Change-Id: I3df5686d13c1ce0cc38402a1317acb661ad74cec
Story: #2006670
(cherry picked from commit 47e31b894e12ca7cc8c476e5b3a194d7d0e15884)
"}]
commit_message:
Add --skip-locks flag to mysql-migrate-db.sh

The --skip-locks flag can be used along with --migrate in
deployments where table locking operations can't be performed.
For example, Percona XtraDB Cluster only has experimental support
for explicit table locking operations and attempts to use locking
will result in errors when PXC Strict Mode is set to ENFORCING.

Change-Id: I3df5686d13c1ce0cc38402a1317acb661ad74cec
Story: #2006670
(cherry picked from commit 47e31b894e12ca7cc8c476e5b3a194d7d0e15884)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 11:50:53.000000000', 'message': 'Send RC announces to release-announce

All releases are announced to the release-announce ML, except
Release candidates, which were still sent to openstack-discuss.

The rationale was that RCs should be announced to a developers
list rather than a downstream consumers list, so that they trigger
testing. But that is less true now that there is a single -discuss
list, where they generate a lot of noise around RC1, without
triggering any additional testing. They also confuse some downstream
consumers which expect those to go to the usual release announce list.

This patch removes the exception and makes sure we send all RC
announces to the release-announce list.

Change-Id: Id33dba37b4d53962a2170ec401499fe3dd2e24bf
'}]
commit_message:
Send RC announces to release-announce

All releases are announced to the release-announce ML, except
Release candidates, which were still sent to openstack-discuss.

The rationale was that RCs should be announced to a developers
list rather than a downstream consumers list, so that they trigger
testing. But that is less true now that there is a single -discuss
list, where they generate a lot of noise around RC1, without
triggering any additional testing. They also confuse some downstream
consumers which expect those to go to the usual release announce list.

This patch removes the exception and makes sure we send all RC
announces to the release-announce list.

Change-Id: Id33dba37b4d53962a2170ec401499fe3dd2e24bf

Looks good but Im dont really know if this works as expected or there are any caveats so a soft +1 from me and I'll let people with more knowledge in this area confirm."}, {'account_id': 18204, 'date': '2019-09-30 15:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2019-09-30 15:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-10-05 19:49:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This seems more appropriate for a liveness probe than a readiness probe - if the OVS-DPDK checks fail, isn't the only solution to restart the pod so neutron-openvswitch-agent-init runs again?

Also, to prevent neutron-ovs-agent from starting prematurely, you could move (or add) the `ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch . dpdk_initialized` check to the openvswitch-vswitchd readiness probe, and/or include it early in _neutron-openvswitch-agent-init.sh.tpl"}, {'account_id': 18256, 'date': '2019-10-06 16:52:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: -Code-Review

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This seems more appropriate for a liveness probe than a readiness
 > probe - if the OVS-DPDK checks fail, isn't the only solution to
 > restart the pod so neutron-openvswitch-agent-init runs again?
 > 
 > Also, to prevent neutron-ovs-agent from starting prematurely, you
 > could move (or add) the `ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch .
 > dpdk_initialized` check to the openvswitch-vswitchd readiness
 > probe, and/or include it early in _neutron-openvswitch-agent-init.sh.tpl

commit_message:
Add readiness checks to ovs agent

This commit adds readiness checks to neutron ovs agent
to check if the ovs and dpdk configurations are working
without errors.

Change-Id: I48277bdbd91ec8121e5fec300aeb646a80a65d29

subject: Octavia use barbican internalURL
messages: [{'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2019-09-23 09:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-09-26 20:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-10-08 12:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 09:49:44.000000000', 'message': 'Octavia use barbican internalURL

OpenStack services communicate with each others using their internal
endpoint. Octavia was using barbican public endpoint, it may cause issue
when creating a TLS termination LB when public endpoint have not a
proper certificat.

Closes-Bug: 1843769
Change-Id: I8d30368d3e4c94161988f8db5861c12030f0120f
(cherry picked from commit e22f1ee93f99f25876857b1c405cab19e00229a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Octavia use barbican internalURL

OpenStack services communicate with each others using their internal
endpoint. Octavia was using barbican public endpoint, it may cause issue
when creating a TLS termination LB when public endpoint have not a
proper certificat.

Closes-Bug: 1843769
Change-Id: I8d30368d3e4c94161988f8db5861c12030f0120f
(cherry picked from commit e22f1ee93f99f25876857b1c405cab19e00229a4)

messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 19:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-08-19 13:17:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'd give a +100 to this if Gerrit allowed me."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-19 15:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

i think the logic makes sense but just because
it bash does not mean we should not use good function and variable names'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-19 15:35:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

I'm OK with this since playing with it locally. I hope to never have to debug it, but since it's an opt-in personal little helper I'm OK with it as-is. commit_message:
tox -e fast-specs

Add a utility, tools/fast-specs.sh, and a corresponding tox target,
fast-specs, to build only spec files changed since the last commit. This
is way faster than building all the specs with tox -e docs, and saves
you having to know several quirks of sphinx-build to do it yourself.

Change-Id: I32223c10cd86379b4d5c337e31d36f5d7820459e

commit_message:
DevStack: Adapt `prefixes` processing

`prefixes` column for the subnetpools was also changed in
python-openstackclient 4.0.0. For better explanations see
I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37. This commit adapts our code
to new openstackclient.

[{'created': '2019-09-19 15:22:49.000000000', 'message': "DevStack: Adapt fixed_ips processing

Seems like python-openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way fixed_ips from
ports are presented, so instead of:

ip_address='10.0.0.89', subnet_id='99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472'

we get:

[{u'subnet_id': u'99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472', u'ip_address':
u'10.0.0.89'}]

This obviously sucks as the latter isn't even JSON, but so is life. This
commit fixes that by using python to parse this.

Change-Id: I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Adapt fixed_ips processing

Seems like python-openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way fixed_ips from
ports are presented, so instead of:

ip_address='10.0.0.89', subnet_id='99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472'

we get:

[{u'subnet_id': u'99dea948-27dd-413c-9e27-ebdd6ae33472', u'ip_address':
u'10.0.0.89'}]

This obviously sucks as the latter isn't even JSON, but so is life. This
commit fixes that by using python to parse this.

Change-Id: I53f56160680555c70fc6d1d87796badf8d2d4e37

[{'created': '2019-10-07 20:22:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix comparison of ping packets loss percentage

Fixed the regex that was used with the grep command to retrive the
percentage of packets loss.
In cases that this percentage wasn't an integer but a decimal fraction,
only the reminder was taken as the percentage number.

If for example the loss percentage was 12.34%, it was calculated as 34%.

* Add a usage in the 'bc' command to allow comparison of integers and
  real numbers.

RHOSINFRA-2809

Change-Id: I4a542eb660581d1441316b95cb6b65f62b3737ca
"}, {'created': '2019-10-07 20:26:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix comparison of ping packets loss percentage

percentage of packets loss.
In cases that this percentage wasn't an integer but a decimal fraction,
only the reminder was taken as the percentage number.

If for example the loss percentage was 12.34%, it was calculated as 34%.

* Add a usage in the 'bc' command to allow comparison of integers and

RHOSINFRA-2809

Change-Id: I4a542eb660581d1441316b95cb6b65f62b3737ca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison of ping packets loss percentage

Fixed the regex that was used with the grep command to retrive the
percentage of packets loss.
In cases that this percentage wasn't an integer but a decimal fraction,
only the reminder was taken as the percentage number.

If for example the loss percentage was 12.34%, it was calculated as 34%.

* Add a usage in the 'bc' command to allow comparison of integers and
  real numbers.

RHOSINFRA-2809

Change-Id: I4a542eb660581d1441316b95cb6b65f62b3737ca

commit_message:
Networking Option 1: Provider networks in Neutron.

Since port :35357 has been dropped in Openstack Queens.
Modifying auth_url = http://controller:35357 to port
5000 in [keystone_authtoken] section of
doc/source/install/controller-install-option1-ubuntu.rst

commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for the openstack-dashboard,
or horizon, project.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: I7824d443f2be67707027a59d3e57c13a42f614be
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639

commit_message:
Adding missing gdisk dependency

The iscsi deployment interface requires the sgdisk binary to
zero/partition the shared block device.
This commits adds the package as dependency.

Change-Id: I948b9712bbc6921d0c43d54e23c30735905a0dc3

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2018-05-21 09:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Migrations can not be backported.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-05-21 12:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe you can modify the db on the basis of the expected: 594422d373ee.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-21 03:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Migrations can not be backported.

This isn't true,  Migrations can be backported along with release notes as long as they stay the same, and in the same order as on newer branches."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-21 03:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-27 03:35:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The PEP8 error[1]:

  FAILED: Expand HEAD file does not match migration timeline head, expected: 594422d373ee

Pretty much calls out that this migration is oit of order.  In that case you need to evaluate the missing migrations.  However the reality of that probably means this backport isn't acceptable.
 
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/50/569750/1/check/openstack-tox-pep8/3476882/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-21_04_07_49_030803"}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-08 14:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Old and issues on migrations order'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 09:02:10.000000000', 'message': 'Router should flip to standby if all L3 nodes down

A HA router should always be active unless all of the agents hosting
that router go down.  In that event, the router should switch to
standby.  This behavior changed with review:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411784

That review seemed to be accounting for a flakey message bus.  This
change should account for that, but also revert to the original behavior
of the router state only changing when its backing agent hosts are down.

Change-Id: I89c3b2546382624f175f8de4de621c3e53adf527
Closes-Bug: 1682145
(cherry picked from commit b62d1bfdf71c2f8810d9b143d50127b8f3a4942d)
'}]
commit_message:
Router should flip to standby if all L3 nodes down

A HA router should always be active unless all of the agents hosting
that router go down.  In that event, the router should switch to
standby.  This behavior changed with review:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411784

That review seemed to be accounting for a flakey message bus.  This
change should account for that, but also revert to the original behavior
of the router state only changing when its backing agent hosts are down.

Change-Id: I89c3b2546382624f175f8de4de621c3e53adf527
Closes-Bug: 1682145
(cherry picked from commit b62d1bfdf71c2f8810d9b143d50127b8f3a4942d)

commit_message:
Support move operations with qos ports - Ussuri

Since microversion 2.72 nova supports creating servers with neutron ports
having resource request. Since the Train release nova also supports cold
migrating and resizing such servers. However other move operations like live
migration, evacuation and unshelve are still not possible due to missing
resource handling implementation in nova.

The main content of this spec was previously proposed and approved in
Train but only partially was implemented. So this spec proposes only the
still missing pieces.

Blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri

commit_message:
Add service status enforcement for consoleauth

Currently service nova-consolueauth doesn't respect the service
status. So even if the service status is set to "disabled" (e.g.
through "nova service-disable"), it still processes requests.
This commit introduces a new class (ServiceWithAdminState) to
provide service status enforcement function. The nova-consoleauth
service is changed to use ServiceWithAdminState.

Closes-Bug: #1299151
Change-Id: Icfcf040c69a67cc244811e6bcb11c75213672e4b
Signed-off-by: Xuanzhou Perry Dong <oss_xzdong@163.com>

commit_message:
Turn process into week-actionable items

It took a non-trivial amount of effort to turn our process into
actionable items for every week of our team tracker. Start
reformatting R-6 to R-4 based on what we just did for Train.

Change-Id: I53189c838875836d030062fa1fd71ba7f0ae1eff

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 07:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Update Ironic UTs to enable REST migration

Intentioanlly break and update of the unit tests to faciltate
an update to utilize keystoneauth adapters to transmit rest
reqeusts. Because the entire client was mocked for the tests,
realistically this needs to be performed in major chunks.

Once the tests are converted, we can begin to update individual
calls to use adapters, with specific microversions that are
explicitly supported.

Additional basic calls were introduced in this patch to enable those
however they are still in-progress.

Change-Id: I506a53f77286c8d872402ce48a51c4b1171813c0
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Update Ironic UTs to enable REST migration

Intentioanlly break and update of the unit tests to faciltate
an update to utilize keystoneauth adapters to transmit rest
reqeusts. Because the entire client was mocked for the tests,
realistically this needs to be performed in major chunks.

Once the tests are converted, we can begin to update individual
calls to use adapters, with specific microversions that are
explicitly supported.

Additional basic calls were introduced in this patch to enable those
however they are still in-progress.

Change-Id: I506a53f77286c8d872402ce48a51c4b1171813c0

commit_message:
grub configuration should use user kernel & ramdisk

compared with pxe_config.template, ramdisk boot with grub should use
aki_path and ari_path

Change-Id: Ibedf375cfeeb20917f06e52b1e86a6990a3c494b
Story: 2006639
Task: 36855

subject: Remove redundant try/except block when authorize

commit_message:
Remove redundant try/except block when authorize

policy.authorize will never raise 'exception.Forbidden' and
already supports return false when authorization failed, remove
the try/except code block in context file.

Change-Id: Iceb40c6806884c952f8bed5f3a664191b77d1b4e

hyper-v: Adds instance live-resize

Implements HyperVDriver live resize implementation.

Depends-On: I5fe95583e6d48578401efccccd6cc8a12582bb9f

Change-Id: I4426122f37bd7c32b26fe5c16cd24e38f77de7c7
Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
db: Adds live-resize to Migration model migration_type

Adds live-resize to the Migration model migration_type Enum.
Adds db migration script which adds 'live-resize' to the Migration
model's migration_type Enum.

Partially Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: I471d930fa6b81b453012d40f9178a211abcbbc50

subject: API: Adds instance live-resize

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-20 18:54:56.000000000', 'message': "Adds instance live resize nova-api microversion

Adds v2.4 microversion incrementation for nova-api.

Adds 'live' argument, which determines the fact that the
instance should be resized live.

Adds 'same_host' argument, which determines the fact that the
instance should resize on the same host.

Checks that the given flavor is larger than the current
instance flavor.

Adds samples for the new microversion increment.

Adds functional tests for the new microversion increment.

DocImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Iede6b9109e09517e98e3a1e5b95f888d7e2aae00

commit_message:
API: Adds instance live-resize

Adds v2.66 nova-api microversion incrementation for live-resize.

Bumps MAX_API_VERSION.
Adds live_resize policy rule.
Adds live-resize api-samples and validation schema.
Adds live-resize instance action and task states.
Checks that the given flavor is larger than the current instance flavor.
Adds functional tests for the new microversion increment.

APIImpact

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Iede6b9109e09517e98e3a1e5b95f888d7e2aae00

commit_message:
conductor: add live_resize task

Bumps ComputeTaskManager's RPC version.
Adds live_resize conductor task.

Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: I196cc79c3ad79f2fefb73ea81492a72d44e70690

commit_message:
compute: Adds instance live-resize

Bumps ComputeManager's and ComputeAPI's RPC versions.
Adds check_instance_live_resize and live_resize_instance
methods to ComputeAPI, ComputeManager, ComputeDriver.

Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Ia10fb835335aabbc3116ba23fd3575f191744778

commit_message:
use import_playbook instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Iff2c977de0c27f62a832170106831231a7438447

commit_message:
Ensure vif handler retry in case of missing ns resources

This patch ensure the on_present event of the vif handler is retried
if all the resources related to the namespace where the pod belongs
are not yet created.

Change-Id: I1345cafffdd98077d23fd8b761c9527ff6316956
Closes-Bug: 1847085

commit_message:
Fix image fetching process for leap 15 and 42.3

The LXC image has a redirection that points to the right image.
We should use it, as aria2 handles it properly.

Squash: I9a2bc7ded20f772af82956a81a9864c7ee17039c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 11082, 'name': 'Kamil Sambor', 'email': 'ksambor@redhat.com', 'username': 'ksambor'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-07 13:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-10-07 13:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2019-10-07 13:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-07 14:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 13:09:48.000000000', 'message': 'Properly catch exceptions when locking a layer

Cls._layer_fetch_lock raises ImageUploaderThreadException when cannot
lock a layer, but this is not being properly catched up with try.
As a result, we can never catch ImageUploaderThreadException in the
code.

Change-Id: I336642272f7ff95174b0be80fb368ae2de76c13c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Properly catch exceptions when locking a layer

Cls._layer_fetch_lock raises ImageUploaderThreadException when cannot
lock a layer, but this is not being properly catched up with try.
As a result, we can never catch ImageUploaderThreadException in the
code.

Change-Id: I336642272f7ff95174b0be80fb368ae2de76c13c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-10-04 12:51:31.000000000', 'message': "Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda

"}]
commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)

commit_message:
Drop "docs" tox target and the docs integration

There is no docs/ directory so trying to build the documentation with
"tox -e docs" fails.

Change-Id: I194d9e04d74e6d7341d4d0b3bc184b94ffd3edfb

commit_message:
openstack-macros: Sync singlespec macros

Update the singlespec macros. This is a copy of the current state in
openSUSE Tumbleweed (from /usr/lib/rpm/macros.d/macros.python_all )

Also output the rendered spec file for debugging

Change-Id: I918ef9e64881e992007d52a0c9d6706b639ce40c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 13:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia7bc7b160ac5530cd12626b6695488d6648405d9
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia7bc7b160ac5530cd12626b6695488d6648405d9

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I8a13402cc47bc33a38182b3340987eefd9026850
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix domain name in install doc (2)

Commit 3f1a89c7dd34c53d5bc9f1190e48ac3a9320bc70 changed most of the
install docs to use "Default" instead of "default" for project/user
domain names according to the keystone docs, but the install doc for
PyPI has been missed. This patch fixes it accordingly.

Change-Id: I2e92730ff5819bf49cf1b286356870fdb9c6ece5
Story: #2006652
Task: #36894
(cherry picked from commit 81da427b337112769e327d550efd4227b11364ff)

commit_message:
simple-init: Use wrappers to call pip for glean install

Use the wrapper calls from Ia267a60eecfa8f4071dd477d86daebe07e9a7e38
to install glean.

Using this wrapper means we cover all cases without more and more
branches; it should work for python2, python3 and also the special
case of RHEL/CentOS where dib-python points to the special
/usr/libexec/platform-python (which is python3.6 with inbuilt pip)

test_update_image is used to test image update API, it's quite
confusing that the upload/download image API is called.

commit_message:
Move upload/download image action to right place

test_update_image is used to test image update API, it's quite
confusing that the upload/download image API is called.

And there is the test for upload/download image API already:
test_register_upload_get_image_file

We should move the upload/download action to the right place.

Change-Id: I18e13cdb81c5ec3fc4abcdd8c8fb21eaf05d4675

[{'created': '2019-10-07 13:56:59.000000000', 'message': "Add --skip-locks flag to mysql-migrate-db.sh

The --skip-locks flag can also be used along with --migrate
in deployments where table locking operations can't be performed.
For example, Percona XtraDB Cluster only has experimental support
for explicit table locking operations and attempts to use locking
will result in errors when PXC Strict Mode is set to ENFORCING.

Change-Id: I3df5686d13c1ce0cc38402a1317acb661ad74cec
Story: #2006670
"}, {'created': '2019-10-07 13:59:22.000000000', 'message': "Add --skip-locks flag to mysql-migrate-db.sh

The --skip-locks flag can be used along with --migrate in
deployments where table locking operations can't be performed.
For example, Percona XtraDB Cluster only has experimental support
for explicit table locking operations and attempts to use locking
will result in errors when PXC Strict Mode is set to ENFORCING.

Change-Id: I3df5686d13c1ce0cc38402a1317acb661ad74cec
Story: #2006670
"}]
commit_message:
Add --skip-locks flag to mysql-migrate-db.sh

The --skip-locks flag can be used along with --migrate in
deployments where table locking operations can't be performed.
For example, Percona XtraDB Cluster only has experimental support
for explicit table locking operations and attempts to use locking
will result in errors when PXC Strict Mode is set to ENFORCING.

Change-Id: I3df5686d13c1ce0cc38402a1317acb661ad74cec
Story: #2006670

commit_message:
Create packaging for neutron-dynamic-routing

This change introduces the initial spec file for neutron-dynamic-routing
and the systemd unit for the BGP dynamic routing agent.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683435

Change-Id: I9c517f8b081e8b538813e9f03d76919292ed72ba

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2bc88982edbc4f62204cb6c15e31111f39379b23

(cherry picked from commit 6b9ddde90096be58510f3e99e81a04211d8f66b4)
'}]
commit_message:
Updated max-width to be dynamic for .member class

When member name is longer than $members-list-item-width
(130px) in members list (for example, project group in Edit
Project), current text-overflow will put ... (ellipsis) at
the end of the name and name will be truncated.

Updated the styling of .member class to make max-width
dynamic 80% and wrap the name in case it is really long.

Change-Id: Ic295a9b1e7fd3525c633d51a60054e713da6a657
Closes-bug: #1843480
(cherry picked from commit b635e625f75744938cde49fd250dd1a5f36ca1b7)
(cherry picked from commit 6b9ddde90096be58510f3e99e81a04211d8f66b4)

commit_message:
Add format string configuration for FWaaS v2 logging

If 'local_output_log_base' is specified, logging can use the
'logging_default_format_string' configuration in l3_agent.ini
like ovs firewall log. It can also set the log level based on
whether debug is enabled.

Change-Id: I7f10361b41acf58987399ea9e0c5720a9129a39b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 21:29:57.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] testing bug/1813789 revert resize events

This is a combination of 2 commits.
This is the 1st commit message:

  Run revert resize tests in nova-live-migration

  In order to test multinode resize revert (which is currently only
  tested in the single node tempest-full-py3 job), this patch renames
  the nova-live-migration job to nova-multinode and makes it run revert
  resize test via a Tempest RC file. The existing live migration and
  evacuate tests are left as post-test hook scripts because they do
  things like change Tempest settings, start Glance, and force down
  compute nodes.

  Change-Id: I980177410c16ecbd809856440ac633453fa20ea8

This is the commit message #2:

  [DNM] use iptables in nova-multinode

  This patch is jsut for testing to see if we can repoduce the
  issue we are seeing downstrem upstream.

  my current working theroy is because we are using iptables
  in the downstream ci which enable the hybrid plug workflow it
  change the timeing of when the network events are sent.

  in a non hybrid plug case the network events are sent after the
  vm is resumed and libvirt plugs the interface back into ovs
  in the hybrid plug case as we have not called unplug on the souce
  node the veth pair and intermeidate linux bridge still exist when
  we activate the souce binding so the event woudl be sent imedetly before
  we start waithgin for it. this is what we belive is the souce of the
  bug and this shoudl hopefully repoduce it.

  Change-Id: Idf0ed84bae0bedbb70b5a65ee804ec1f2f4a27ee

Change-Id: I3e53c76812ac6614d10a7fdbbc0584c81a4b60b2

This is a combination of 2 commits.
This is the 1st commit message:

  Run revert resize tests in nova-live-migration

  In order to test multinode resize revert (which is currently only
  tested in the single node tempest-full-py3 job), this patch renames
  the nova-live-migration job to nova-multinode and makes it run revert
  resize test via a Tempest RC file. The existing live migration and
  evacuate tests are left as post-test hook scripts because they do
  things like change Tempest settings, start Glance, and force down
  compute nodes.

  Change-Id: I980177410c16ecbd809856440ac633453fa20ea8

This is the commit message #2:

  [DNM] use iptables in nova-multinode

  This patch is jsut for testing to see if we can repoduce the
  issue we are seeing downstrem upstream.

  my current working theroy is because we are using iptables
  in the downstream ci which enable the hybrid plug workflow it
  change the timeing of when the network events are sent.

  in a non hybrid plug case the network events are sent after the
  vm is resumed and libvirt plugs the interface back into ovs
  in the hybrid plug case as we have not called unplug on the souce
  node the veth pair and intermeidate linux bridge still exist when
  we activate the souce binding so the event woudl be sent imedetly before
  we start waithgin for it. this is what we belive is the souce of the
  bug and this shoudl hopefully repoduce it.

  Change-Id: Idf0ed84bae0bedbb70b5a65ee804ec1f2f4a27ee

commit_message:
[DNM] testing bug/1813789 revert resize events

This is a combination of 2 commits.
This is the 1st commit message:

  Run revert resize tests in nova-live-migration

  In order to test multinode resize revert (which is currently only
  tested in the single node tempest-full-py3 job), this patch renames
  the nova-live-migration job to nova-multinode and makes it run revert
  resize test via a Tempest RC file. The existing live migration and
  evacuate tests are left as post-test hook scripts because they do
  things like change Tempest settings, start Glance, and force down
  compute nodes.

  Change-Id: I980177410c16ecbd809856440ac633453fa20ea8

This is the commit message #2:

  [DNM] use iptables in nova-multinode

  This patch is jsut for testing to see if we can repoduce the
  issue we are seeing downstrem upstream.

  my current working theroy is because we are using iptables
  in the downstream ci which enable the hybrid plug workflow it
  change the timeing of when the network events are sent.

  in a non hybrid plug case the network events are sent after the
  vm is resumed and libvirt plugs the interface back into ovs
  in the hybrid plug case as we have not called unplug on the souce
  node the veth pair and intermeidate linux bridge still exist when
  we activate the souce binding so the event woudl be sent imedetly before
  we start waithgin for it. this is what we belive is the souce of the
  bug and this shoudl hopefully repoduce it.

  Change-Id: Idf0ed84bae0bedbb70b5a65ee804ec1f2f4a27ee

Change-Id: I3e53c76812ac6614d10a7fdbbc0584c81a4b60b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-03 01:07:59.000000000', 'message': 'simple-init: default to NetworkManager for CentOS and Fedora

NetworkManager with simple-init has proven to be stable in OpenStack
infra, switch to it by default for CentOS and Fedora.  For CentOS 8
and Fedora, add a check to make it the only option.  Thus only CenOS 7
remains optionally using the legacy scripts; this is likely not used
anywhere (infra is really the primary user, where NetworkManager is
already used); we can likely remove this path but that is left for a
further cleanup.

In the setup, remove rhel7 element which was never really tested.  Add
a fall-through to catch if we run in untested environments.

Change-Id: Ic996956da4b85f7d95179b8df9881d5f52c091af

commit_message:
simple-init: default to NetworkManager for CentOS and Fedora

NetworkManager with simple-init has proven to be stable in OpenStack
infra, switch to it by default for CentOS and Fedora.  For CentOS 8
and Fedora, add a check to make it the only option.  Thus only CenOS 7
remains optionally using the legacy scripts; this is likely not used
anywhere (infra is really the primary user, where NetworkManager is
already used); we can likely remove this variable (and hence path) in
a future cleanup.

In the setup, remove rhel7 element which was never really tested.
Reorganise the fallthrough to call out the default paths as doing
nothing.

Change-Id: Ic996956da4b85f7d95179b8df9881d5f52c091af

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

held back amqp-2.5.2
waiting for https://github.com/celery/kombu/commit/b51d1d678e198a80d7e5fd95f32674c7d8e04a75
to be in a release...

hard pinning sucks

salt also caps pyyaml, I'm siding with pyyaml

Change-Id: I0b2eae0e848416e05430278a5a934a256b0ee001
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Pass ssh public key as string

* Fedora CoreOS need the key to be passed as
  a string.
* We can adopt in all drivers so that users in
  the same project can do cluster resize.

story: 2005201
task: 36934

Change-Id: I9a18ce4dcbd74f0dcd23274baed7c8c3d2029d50
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibea91b933f0aa2c2c1eeb1fb943fa6628ffa2291

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I50c6b29ce85eaef237fd870b1a37c38b1282fb5a

commit_message:
Add a non-racy check for unique stack names

Make sure that the database can only contain one active stack with a
given name per tenant.

Change-Id: Icc3cd6900fa116a5e43054c7589195222ef90c78
Task: 27824

commit_message:
[Gate fix] Avoid use cell_uuid before assignment

Found this error in heat gate during running grenade test job.

Should not asking to provide cell_uuid if queue.get is timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1847131

Change-Id: I7f9edc9a4b4930f4dce98df271888fa8082a1701

commit_message:
Remove workaround for bug #1709118

A possible fix [1] for bug #1709118 is in keystoneauth1 release 3.3.0.
This change removes a workaround for that bug in
nova.utils.get_endpoint.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500956/

Change-Id: If2a56ed56ecb3402fdee1189df81f0b9fbc483b3
Related-Bug: #1709118

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here. For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I750d6acaa3231b60fe1680b59d483fe10b091017

commit_message:
Stop using mox stubs in nova/tests/unit/cells/fakes.py

Replace 'stubs.Set' with 'stub_out' in
nova/tests/unit/cells/fakes.py

Partially implements: blueprint remove-mox-ocata

Change-Id: Ib3e83758c015a5f2f8944b505d7773c81ba984b7

commit_message:
XStatic-*: Move to python3 only

Horion is python3 only so there is no need to build a python2 package
of the XStatic packages.

Change-Id: Id3efa8c03015b00fd11ff716e25464499c80811b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-01 11:49:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I27c8441332c9ccc420f46b9defd4ed4d3a71da14
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I27c8441332c9ccc420f46b9defd4ed4d3a71da14

commit_message:
Handle unset OVN_SRCDIR

Allow the usage of system-installed OVN. This will allow tests that
use ovsdbapp's venv.py in networking-ovn to pass.

Change-Id: I427f5c87058de04db21b23b26d5f1070b2efeb61

Commit 3f1a89c7dd34c53d5bc9f1190e48ac3a9320bc70 changed most of the

commit_message:
Fix domain name in install doc (2)

Commit 3f1a89c7dd34c53d5bc9f1190e48ac3a9320bc70 changed most of the
install docs to use "Default" instead of "default" for project/user
domain names according to the keystone docs, but the install doc for
PyPI has been missed. This patch fixes it accordingly.

Change-Id: I2e92730ff5819bf49cf1b286356870fdb9c6ece5
Story: #2006652
Task: #36894

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 08:24:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313

subject: Update policy.d spec to reflect what actually happened
messages: [{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-10-03 17:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-10-08 08:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-03 17:09:49.000000000', 'message': "Update policy.d spec to reflect what actually happened

These changes are not about 'intent', but rather how the intent
translated into practice.  There were two charms that didn't need
overrides, and this created space for an additional charm to be included
in the 19.10 release cycle.  Also, more in-depth testing was possible,
and the spec is updated to reflect that.

Change-Id: Idcd59828ce81581f8e088948a3d55b38b06cbdf7
"}]
commit_message:
Update policy.d spec to reflect what actually happened

These changes are not about 'intent', but rather how the intent
translated into practice.  There were two charms that didn't need
overrides, and this created space for an additional charm to be included
in the 19.10 release cycle.  Also, more in-depth testing was possible,
and the spec is updated to reflect that.

Change-Id: Idcd59828ce81581f8e088948a3d55b38b06cbdf7

commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for nova-cloud-controler.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: Ia5f3f8189d4a7b7b46a827707d964ebe40740aeb
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639

subject: Spec: V1 API rating modules endpoints migration to V2 API
messages:
[{'account_id': 30960, 'date': '2019-09-18 13:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-18 13:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-09-19 09:32:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Fix unit tests with ironicclient >=3.0.0

We need to mock all invocations of the ironic client,
otherwise we see failures with python-ironicclient 3.0.0.

Change-Id: I9279d79f039177e150a59aefa5c660c568dd18b6
(cherry picked from commit 66faa425b97c8be9ea1cfb0ac65f4e5ff3476997)

commit_message:
Implement generation of shared secret for metadata

The ``nova-compute`` charm gates enablement of the local Nova
metadata service on presence of the ``metadata-shared-secret``
key in the relation data in the subordinate relation with
``neutron-plugin`` interface.  This is implemented in the classic
``neutron-openvswitch`` charm today.

Add the bits necessary for a reactive charm to participate in this
part of the relation.

Also adds units tests to the interface.

Change-Id: I358e60c40a7f7c0cd33b31f2b7a8c58d6cb83326

commit_message:
Fix placement of Octavia services in roles

Octavia health manager, worker and housekeeping services belong to
networker nodes.

Change-Id: I014a3a5ac2b0b5f32866fa9d5c09ac7e79475e79

commit_message:
check-review-status: update age calc

This patch changes the approval script to allow approving the change
after 7 days. This should also clarify all the "earliest" dates by
making sure they have a time in UTC.

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Change-Id: I611dd4e44928c42dae35fd9527a62fa948a2cc3f

commit_message:
Squash database patches

Remove patches up to the Newton release to speed up
initial deployment and tests, as we don't support
previous versions anymore.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/686996
Change-Id: I49129d926c0ea3d613a4ab698cbeb46c06547813

[DNM] Bump shas to test if neutron is borked

To help our friends from kolla at first, then to see if our upgrades
won't be borked.

commit_message:
Fix tempest source install condition

Because of jinja2 templating delimiters inside when statement tempest
wasn't correctly installed from source.
Also condition is simplified to be more readable. install_method check
works as we would like to run venv installation only for source
installs, but not for the ubuntu mixed setup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/686041
Change-Id: I39332a35fb2edae65a4762fe24c5b1f8c8675a2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 08:22:04.000000000', 'message': 'resolve confusing state when rebuilding

When nova-compute starts, all instances in rebuilding
state will be set to error and task_state[None].
if then nova-compute receives rpc to rebuild instance,
will raise UnexpectedTaskStateError. So confusing state
occurs:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuilding)
Finally, instance will keep REBUILD even though rebuilding
terminated.
I change the exception handling for UnexpectedTaskStateError,
if decide to resume rebuild, state changing likes:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) ->
REBUILD(rebuild_spawning) -> ACTIVE(None)
else:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None)

Closes-Bug: #1741817
Change-Id: I8ecfe610568f7654503bd48f01f0477525a20b23
'}, {'created': '2018-01-19 08:27:42.000000000', 'message': 'resolve confusing state when rebuilding

commit_message:
resolve confusing state when rebuilding

When nova-compute starts, all instances in rebuilding state will be set to error
and task_state[None].
If then nova-compute receives rpc to rebuild instance, will raise
UnexpectedTaskStateError. So confusing state occurs:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuilding)
Finally, instance will keep REBUILD even though rebuilding terminated.
I change the exception handling for UnexpectedTaskStateError,
if decide to resume rebuild, state changing likes:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuild_spawning) -> ACTIVE(None)
else:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None)

Closes-Bug: #1741817
Change-Id: I8ecfe610568f7654503bd48f01f0477525a20b23

commit_message:
Disable ip_version checking while updating member without new ip

If member gets updated with new data, but without IP version
we shouldn't be checking if ip_version differs from the listener.

Related-Bug: #1843553

Change-Id: I5edfc70efeaa0758373ecfb2fa12f4721c6fb1f8

Yeah I definitely hit something like this today in devstack which was really weird, I was getting messages about starting the instance and then messages about removing allocations and resetting the task_state on error:

$ sudo journalctl -a -u devstack@n-cpu.service | grep 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d
Jul 30 21:15:11 devstack nova-compute[29645]: DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [None req-a4247c77-5e4c-4e48-ba09-00f5d2903f23 admin admin] Lock "33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d" acquired by "nova.compute.manager._locked_do_build_and_run_instance" :: waited 0.001s {{(pid=29645) inner /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:327}}
Jul 30 21:15:11 devstack nova-compute[29645]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [None req-a4247c77-5e4c-4e48-ba09-00f5d2903f23 admin admin] [instance: 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d] Starting instance... {{(pid=29645) _do_build_and_run_instance /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:1955}}
Jul 30 21:15:39 devstack nova-compute[29645]: DEBUG nova.compute.resource_tracker [None req-d3dab5d4-eefe-461b-b28f-cc092037cb33 None None] Instance 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d has been scheduled to this compute host, the scheduler has made an allocation against this compute node but the instance has yet to start. Skipping heal of allocation: {u'resources': {u'VCPU': 1, u'MEMORY_MB': 512, u'DISK_GB': 1}}. {{(pid=29645) _remove_deleted_instances_allocations /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py:1385}}
Jul 30 21:16:11 devstack nova-compute[29645]: INFO nova.compute.manager [None req-a4247c77-5e4c-4e48-ba09-00f5d2903f23 admin admin] [instance: 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d] Successfully reverted task state from None on failure for instance.
Jul 30 21:16:12 devstack nova-compute[29645]: INFO nova.scheduler.client.report [None req-a4247c77-5e4c-4e48-ba09-00f5d2903f23 admin admin] Deleted allocation for instance 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d
Jul 30 21:16:12 devstack nova-compute[29645]: DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [None req-a4247c77-5e4c-4e48-ba09-00f5d2903f23 admin admin] Lock "33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d" released by "nova.compute.manager._locked_do_build_and_run_instance" :: held 60.839s {{(pid=29645) inner /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:339}}


This message makes it clear that instance.host is not set:

Jul 30 21:15:39 devstack nova-compute[29645]: DEBUG nova.compute.resource_tracker [None req-d3dab5d4-eefe-461b-b28f-cc092037cb33 None None] Instance 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d has been scheduled to this compute host, the scheduler has made an allocation against this compute node but the instance has yet to start. Skipping heal of allocation: {u'resources': {u'VCPU': 1, u'MEMORY_MB': 512, u'DISK_GB': 1}}. {{(pid=29645) _remove_deleted_instances_allocations /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py:1385}}

I added some debug logging and restarted n-cpu and the instance is stuck in BUILD status:

$ openstack server list
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+--------+----------+--------------------------+---------+
| ID                                   | Name                          | Status | Networks | Image                    | Flavor  |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+--------+----------+--------------------------+---------+
| 33f64d9c-0a1a-410c-b5ba-e32ab501098d | test-img-back-vm-with-img-vol | BUILD  |          | cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk | m1.tiny |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+--------+----------+--------------------------+---------+


So agree it would be better if it were put into ERROR status on restart if there is no host and it's stuck in BUILD status.

Now I just need to dig into your code change. :)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-30 22:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

OK I think I found my issue at least. There was a MessagingTimeout trying to set the instance vm_state to building here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/78ce2e89e566df28e0c802c8a1891d7065fbdcf6/nova/compute/manager.py#L1958

The instance doesn't go to ERROR status but I was able to pull the fault from the DB:

> In the particular case of Ironic it will increase for sure the starting time, but shouldn't be dramatic. We will only find out when testing it at scale.

If this turns out to be a problem, we could consider threading out the cleanup based on config or something about the type of compute driver being used (I'd like to avoid a straight call to check the hypervisor type or compute driver config value, but we could look at some capability on the driver that is only true for ironic - maybe that's too hacky as well, IDK). This could also be a problem for vCenter but they only have 1 compute node but still 1K+ instances/consumers potentially on that one compute node so it could be a slow start time for that driver as well. I'll ask cdent to take a look at this - maybe VIO has a test simulator for this kind of thing for performance testing."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-18 15:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-18 15:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

[{'created': '2019-06-21 14:54:03.000000000', 'message': 'Error out interrupted builds

If the compute service is restarted while build build requests are
executing the instance_claim or waiting for the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
then those instances will stuck forever in BUILDING state. If the instance
already finished instance_claim then instance.host is set and when the
compute restarts the instance is put to ERROR state.

This patch ensures that the instances that are in BUILDING state, has
allocation towards the compute but the instance.host is not set to that
compute are also put in ERROR state during compute service startup.

Change-Id: I856a3032c83fc2f605d8c9b6e5aa3bcfa415f96a
Closes-Bug: #1833581

commit_message:
Error out interrupted builds

If the compute service is restarted while build requests are
executing the instance_claim or waiting for the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
then those instances will be stuck forever in BUILDING state. If the instance
already finished instance_claim then instance.host is set and when the
compute restarts the instance is put to ERROR state.

This patch changes compute service startup to put instances into
ERROR state if they a) are in the BUILDING state, and b) have
allocations on the compute resource provider, but c) do not have
instance.host set to that compute.

Change-Id: I856a3032c83fc2f605d8c9b6e5aa3bcfa415f96a
Closes-Bug: #1833581

Hum, nice, if we can add ir to the mix we could run commands that generate scripts and lint those scripts (tags create_*_*_scripts) ?

We could test that workaround scripts generation works too and generate expected output.  We could maybe add file in the tests directory as a dummy workaround, run it (with script generation only) and check it's good.

commit_message:
Introduce molecule tests in the tripleo-upgrade role

This patch adds the first structure to
run molecule and test this role

It includes a basic escenario to run the tripleo-upgrade
role without parameters.

Change-Id: I3fdb22b5496bb0c16cc4201f542366e97fc0e1fc

There would be some issue for my commit.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 03:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'get swift info when we run tempest.

when I run tempest on swift ("tempest run --regex="^tempest.api.object_storage.*") I've encountered an error as for the following api test.

setUpClass (tempest.api.object_storage.test_healthcheck.HealthcheckTest)

and I edited the 2 files. Still, we are able to get swift info and swift health check info.

Change-Id: I0838332ffa71c2fec9dc8a0fde83f8c7c83c6055
'}, {'created': '2019-10-08 03:38:48.000000000', 'message': 'get swift health-check info when we run tempest.

I tested the following api test (tempest.api.object_storage.test_healthcheck.HealthcheckTest).
Before the test, I installed and configured ceph-radosgateway in order to use RGW-Swift.

I edited the 2 files. and then I can successfully get the health status.

Change-Id: I0838332ffa71c2fec9dc8a0fde83f8c7c83c6055
'}]
commit_message:
get swift health-check info when we run tempest.

I tested the following api test (tempest.api.object_storage.test_healthcheck.HealthcheckTest).
Before the test, I installed and configured ceph-radosgateway in order to use RGW-Swift.

I edited the 2 files. and then I can successfully get the health status.

Change-Id: I0838332ffa71c2fec9dc8a0fde83f8c7c83c6055

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Note that release note for train doesn't seem to be ready.
(no 4_0_0_0_hash file exists)

Change-Id: Ia1f9e21af0eab90e1685e9e482fd8affcc415989
Sem-Ver: feature

Why not just use networks='none' with microversion 2.37? Then nova literally doesn't allocate any networking for the instance."}, {'account_id': 28722, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:41:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> Why not just use networks='none' with microversion 2.37? Then nova
 > literally doesn't allocate any networking for the instance.

Looks like the author's idea of this patch is to create VM with network adapters, i.e. do not fail if subnet is not set for network or port doesn't have fixed_ip.
While with network='none' we will get VM without any network adapters.
Mathieu Rohon, please, correct me if I am wrong."}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2018-07-30 13:40:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

you're totally right anton, sorry for the delay"}, {'account_id': 26693, 'date': '2018-11-20 13:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-11-20 14:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Allow VMs to use unaddressed ports

Users can create a port with ip_allocation=none, which means
that the port will never have an IP. The result is a port
with fixed_ips=[].
Nova needs a fixed ip to be set to apply security groups,
but security groups are only allowed on a neutron port if its
port_security attribute is set to True.
Hence, nova can allow a VM to boot with an unaddressed port specified if
that port has its port_security set to False.

Change-Id: Ic622f9a98766bf583b8fd478bd2637cc562b3f80
Implements: blueprint vm-boot-with-unaddressed-port
Closes-Bug: #1741575

subject: auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE
messages: [{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-07-25 07:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-10-08 03:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 07:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE

This is more of a POC. The idea is pretty straight forward.

Before this patch:
 - a leader is determined to be the scanner node
 - that node will then go scan for shard ranges.
 - Once found, the scanner/leader asks via an all quorum if they're
   still the leader.
 - If they are, then write the shard ranges into my DB and let
   replication spread them out.

This sounds great. But there is an edge case, what happens if the
replication fails? We can't roll back the shard ranges by removing
them locally because the container replicators in the meal while might
have already managed to push somewhere because of a network blip.

For example, what happens if replication is down for that node after writing
the ranges, or the server goes down for maintenence, and a rebalance
happens, and now this "leader" who has shard ranges is a handoff. But
will still offload it's ranges when back online. Even after another leader
has since been elected and replicated a different set of ranges.

This patch is trying solve that edge case by  reducing that potentail gap
between the finding and inserting shard ranges locally and it's eventual
replication.
It does it by taking advantage of the "still leader" quorum. If it still
is the leader after finding shard ranges, it goes and updates the other
primaries using the new container UPDATE verb. So long as one of those
is successful, it's safe to write the shard ranges locally.
If all UPDATEs fail, the scanner safely throws away the ranges and will
have another go when the connection or whatever is back.

It in essence gives us a rollback without having to be smart with
replication locking (locking out the container-replicators) writing and
checking if we managed to replication in the sharder.

This is just a POC to test out the theory, just a possible solution.

The real question is, is the edgecase real? Or can we somehow just be
smarter in replication.

Change-Id: I39f07180ce7990702e4fdfe7e43f313781d7e7d3
'}, {'created': '2019-10-08 03:54:49.000000000', 'message': 'auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE

happens, and now this "leader" who has shard ranges is a handoff. But
will still offload it's ranges when back online. Even after another leader
has since been elected and replicated a different set of ranges.

This patch is trying solve that edge case by  reducing that potentail gap
between the finding and inserting shard ranges locally and it's eventual
replication.
It does it by taking advantage of the "still leader" quorum. If it still
is the leader after finding shard ranges, it goes and updates the other
primaries using the new container UPDATE verb. So long as one of those
is successful, it's safe to write the shard ranges locally.
If all UPDATEs fail, the scanner safely throws away the ranges and will
have another go when the connection or whatever is back.

It in essence gives us a rollback without having to be smart with
replication locking (locking out the container-replicators) writing and
checking if we managed to replication in the sharder.

This is just a POC to test out the theory, just a possible solution.

The real question is, is the edgecase real? Or can we somehow just be

Change-Id: I39f07180ce7990702e4fdfe7e43f313781d7e7d3
'}]
commit_message:
auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE

This is more of a POC. The idea is pretty straight forward.

Before this patch:
 - a leader is determined to be the scanner node
 - that node will then go scan for shard ranges.
 - Once found, the scanner/leader asks via an all quorum if they're
   still the leader.
 - If they are, then write the shard ranges into my DB and let
   replication spread them out.

This sounds great. But there is an edge case, what happens if the
replication fails? We can't roll back the shard ranges by removing
them locally because the container replicators in the meal while might
have already managed to push somewhere because of a network blip.

For example, what happens if replication is down for that node after writing
the ranges, or the server goes down for maintenence, and a rebalance
happens, and now this "leader" who has shard ranges is a handoff. But
will still offload it's ranges when back online. Even after another leader
has since been elected and replicated a different set of ranges.

This patch is trying solve that edge case by  reducing that potentail gap
between the finding and inserting shard ranges locally and it's eventual
replication.
It does it by taking advantage of the "still leader" quorum. If it still
is the leader after finding shard ranges, it goes and updates the other
primaries using the new container UPDATE verb. So long as one of those
is successful, it's safe to write the shard ranges locally.
If all UPDATEs fail, the scanner safely throws away the ranges and will
have another go when the connection or whatever is back.

It in essence gives us a rollback without having to be smart with
replication locking (locking out the container-replicators) writing and
checking if we managed to replication in the sharder.

This is just a POC to test out the theory, just a possible solution.

The real question is, is the edgecase real? Or can we somehow just be
smarter in replication.

Change-Id: I39f07180ce7990702e4fdfe7e43f313781d7e7d3

commit_message:
Support noauth2 auth_strategy

Currently, noauth2 auth_strategy is not supported. If you specify
[DEFAULT]auth_strategy=noauth2 in `/etc/masakari/ masakari.conf`
and start the masakari api service, it gives ImportError.

Added NoAuthMiddleware to support noauth2 auth_strategy.

Closes-Bug: #1836354
Change-Id: I288cd5838b09d3e6c31b6408fff85e6bb5f529a6

commit_message:
Cleanup instances test data

Instances are not cleanup properly after functional tests finished
execution. This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I77456ef967addb42c31033f4e08adb2b868a7323
Closes-bug: #1838418

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 12:52:52.000000000', 'message': 'Raising minimum version of oslo.db

oslo.db was not compatible with Python 3.7 until version 4.40.0
because Python 3.7 makes "async" a keyword [1].
To prevent bad surprises, this patch increases the minumum version
required for oslo.db to 4.40.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/574833

Change-Id: I3271fd2d7d81261db6da079e55fb87656c833686
'}]
commit_message:
Raising minimum version of oslo.db

oslo.db was not compatible with Python 3.7 until version 4.40.0
because Python 3.7 makes "async" a keyword [1].
To prevent bad surprises, this patch increases the minumum version
required for oslo.db to 4.40.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/574833

Change-Id: I3271fd2d7d81261db6da079e55fb87656c833686

commit_message:
Replace the driver name of iptables_v2 with the namespace

The configured driver iptables_v2 has been moved, automatically using
neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.agents.drivers.linux.iptables_fwaas_v2.IptablesFwaasDriver instead. [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/fwaas-v2-scenario.html#enable-fwaas-v2

Change-Id: I2b300d0b7d66029dd631d0b790c46267a5e889e7
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 01:21:56.000000000', 'message': 'Don't use --registry-url for image show auth

This doesn't work for registries like docker.io because they expect
the authentication url to include the namespace so they can determine
the allowed scope of the request.

Instead the image reference is used for authentication, and the docs
include examples to make it clear that the registry host needs to be
included in the image reference.

This change also makes json the default formatter for the show
command, so it can be used as a drop-in replacement for "skopeo
inspect" and so that the output format is consistent with the docker
commands.

Change-Id: I30ce5c53e3eac758f52f31cc9ed3f2dff35eb4cb
Closes-Bug: #1845400
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use --registry-url for image show auth

This doesn't work for registries like docker.io because they expect
the authentication url to include the namespace so they can determine
the allowed scope of the request.

Instead the image reference is used for authentication, and the docs
include examples to make it clear that the registry host needs to be
included in the image reference.

This change also makes json the default formatter for the show
command, so it can be used as a drop-in replacement for "skopeo
inspect" and so that the output format is consistent with the docker
commands.

Change-Id: I30ce5c53e3eac758f52f31cc9ed3f2dff35eb4cb
Closes-Bug: #1845400

commit_message:
Don't raise when raw template files not found during delete

During raw template files delete, if we can't found any files,
just return instead raise NotFound.

Change-Id: I680f1931096a1e20282f769873879c3bdd648a34
Task: 36945

commit_message:
fixtures: Handle iterable params for 'NeutronFixture.list_*'

It turns out it's possible to filter on multiple possible values using
by using an iterable query value. We're going to need this for proper
subnet mocking, so add it now. There's no impact on tests.

Change-Id: Ia02ff34ec94a911906e2e812ab6503d4a2118bce

commit_message:
fixtures: Beef up NeutronFixture

The sample networks, subnets and ports this used were missing a lot of
fields that the neutron API returns. Beef these up to match something
like what we'd receive from a modern neutron instance. Note that this
does involve some shuffling around of lines, but that's intentional to
make things easier to diff. A future change will add proper security
group and floating IP support.

Change-Id: Ib07303d3ad96110d7d416a3d6e1e9197420f8680
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

functions from the neutronclient in our NeutronFixture.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_simple_tenant_usage' functional tests

This test case is using common samples and falling back to the v2.37
server create request sample which uses auto-network creation rather
than a specific network ID. As a result, we must mock the relevant
functions from the neutronclient in our NeutronFixture.

Change-Id: I28493775b9135b8fb4d778963a2b227a4d8ed0a2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add update_reservation to dummy plugin

update_reservation is now an abstract method. It needs to be added to
all plugins.

Change-Id: I921878bd5233613b804b17813af1aac5bdfed9e7

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_attach_interfaces' functional tests

This one is a little more involved and I'm not actually sure how it was
working before, since nova-net doesn't seem to support the 'show_port'
method. In short though, we're rewriting stuff to mock or wrap the
neutron implementation of nova's 'network' API. We also get to remove
some unnecessary mocks that the 'NeutronFixture' will now handle for us.

Change-Id: I15323a342d53cebd43f3a645528bc96489f19bc3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fixtures: Store 'device_id' when creating port in NeutronFixture

When creating a port, we send a bit of information to neutron, namely,
the requested network, the tenant (project) ID and, crucially, the
device ID. The 'NeutronFixture' should be setting these fields on the
created port but is not. This hasn't been an issue to date but will when
we add subnet support, so fix this now.

Change-Id: Ia842854c12cd2d2ed630d1e0f2bb691859592cd9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: Idaf347c183fe35d346f15b24c0bfad0585b082fc

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here. For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I4d312087fdf00d297f5bf1fdef0bd234f8543651
