[{'created': '2019-09-24 13:53:00.000000000', 'message': "nova-net: Migrate 'test_server_tags' functional tests

This one happens because the 'security_groups' field isn't present if
you're using neutron.

Change-Id: Ia9456055bc4defaefa98cfa82484b9ce5c8792e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-09-27 08:42:31.000000000', 'message': "nova-net: Migrate 'test_server_tags' functional tests

This one happens because the 'security_groups' field isn't present if
you're using neutron.

Change-Id: Ia9456055bc4defaefa98cfa82484b9ce5c8792e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-09-30 15:14:30.000000000', 'message': "nova-net: Migrate 'test_server_tags' functional tests

We need to bulk up the neutron driver to ensure security groups are
returned on a per-instance basis. Because we fix this, we end up needing
to update an unrelated test.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_server_tags' functional tests

Since we already worked on the NeutronFixture to return security groups
in change Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, this now just
works.

Change-Id: Ia9456055bc4defaefa98cfa82484b9ce5c8792e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here. For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: Ie7c11ab1ad810dc5a766a55fbc2640df428258c2

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_quota_sets' functional tests

This one is long because network quotas aren't a thing when using
neutron, which means we need to remove them from all the samples.

Change-Id: I9cb2fb1b3817797a53c1331d666750399a7f5f87
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda

commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)

commit_message:
Add mariadb backup capability to mariadb chart

 * backup script for mariadb
 * restore script for mariadb
 * cronjob to control backup automation for mariadb
 * add parameters to values.yaml

Change-Id: Ib0b6744f519ea1919507df0c2a50b45b27ac86ab

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_hypervisors' functional tests

There's one less service with nova-network disabled, meaning the host
indexes are off by one. We just use a regex sub to avoid needing to
change this.

Change-Id: I5c8496f7287634a0db50f4545c43aeba33b75e6b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-27 12:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487

commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_rescue' functional tests

Since we already worked on the NeutronFixture to return security groups
in change Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, this now just
works.

Change-Id: I16215c4bfddf874c9705d4746f911dfeaac624f6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix port info lookup parsing

The output format for "openstack port show" has changed breaking the
octavia deployment ansible. This patch changes the output format to json
and uses json_query to parse out the results.

Closes-Bug: #1846399
Change-Id: I3b5c989259fd4347c41d392ad79bfd6b9459d605

commit_message:
Use dynamic argument_spec from documentation

This change modifies the argument_spec making it so we load the options
key from the documentation constant. This will reduce the code we have
to maintain and ensure our documentation is always in sync with the
module capabilities.

Change-Id: Ib3e56f94debd6e99d9319902517811cf77ecc874
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_servers' functional tests

Three tests require modification to specifically request an API that our
NeutronFixture provides. The rest just work (TM).

Change-Id: I423b7ab5c98ea9d559caefec0b49271e28a140fa
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 12:16:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)

commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)

messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-01 10:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-01 10:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Discussed this with slaweq on #openstack-neutron and gibi on #openstack-nova. tl;dr: it's conceivable that there would be no security groups applied, but it's not the default behavior. We're not worrying about that edge case here so I think we're good.

---

<stephenfin> Morning, all. Say, is there something explicit in neutron that says we have to have at least one security group? A default, if you will
<slaweq> stephenfin: hi, are You asking about docs? or code?
<stephenfin> code
<slaweq> IIRC, You can't remove default security group but You don't need to use it
<slaweq> You can have port without security groups at all
<stephenfin> Ah, you can?
<slaweq> stephenfin: yes, but You have to set port-security to false and than You have no security groups for such port
<slaweq> if port-security is set to true, You always have to have at least 1 SG for such port
<stephenfin> slaweq: Hmm, okay, so fair to say it's possible but you'd have to do something different from the default? I ask because of https://review.opendev.org/685927
<stephenfin> That nova change is modifying the NeutronFixture we use to mock out Neutron to "properly" mock the security group calls
<stephenfin> here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685927/1/nova/tests/fixtures.py
<slaweq> stephenfin: yes, IMO it's fair to say that
<slaweq> by default ports have got port_security enabled and default SG is assigned to such port if there was no other SG specified in request
<stephenfin> and all the unmocked function is doing is getting all ports for each instance, extracting the security groups from those ports, and using that to build an instance-security groups mapping
<slaweq> so it will always have some SG
<stephenfin> sweet
<stephenfin> thanks very much, slaweq++ :)
<slaweq> stephenfin: yw

---

<gibi> stephenfin: do I understand the situation that the nova net base sample tests was not covered the sec group case and now that you add neutron based sample tests which has sec group you discovered a bug in the api behavior?
<stephenfin> that seems to be my understanding
<stephenfin> *that is my understanding :)
<stephenfin> gibi: Basically, I'm not sure if https://review.opendev.org/685927 is correct or not
<stephenfin> I mean, the addition of that field to two APIs
<stephenfin> I guess I will need to look at a real cloud with a down cell to see what actually comes back
<stephenfin> Or spend ages trying to trace stuff :(
<gibi> your fixture is coded with the assumption that neutron returns at least the default security group for every instance. If this assumption correct then what I think what you see in the test is the actual nova behavior
<gibi> if that leads to unexpecte API response then that is a bug
<stephenfin> Sort. I think it's more like I'm assuming an instance has at least one security group regardless of its state
<gibi> stephenfin: yeah your view is more precies you would need to validate that assumption first
<gibi> I think neutron behavior should not be cell dependent
<stephenfin> Yeah, neither do I
<stephenfin> I've no idea where to start on validating that assumption though so ima wait til sean-k-mooney or mriedem are about :)
<gibi> :)
<gibi> in devstack if I do nothing special I get the default sec group
<stephenfin> Yeah, that's what I was seeing too
<stephenfin> gibi: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/security-groups.html
<stephenfin> "All projects have a default security group which is applied to any instance that has no other defined security group. Unless you change the default, this security group denies all incoming traffic and allows only outgoing traffic to your instance."
<gibi> after I stop the n-cond-cell1 service in my devstack I still see the default sec group returned by nova
<gibi> stephenfin: based on that doc your assumption is valid'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-10-01 11:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
tests: Correctly mock out security groups in NeutronFixture

For our immediate purposes, this should always return something so we
modify the mock to do just that. That requires some modifications to
existing tests but is otherwise pretty simple. A future change will
address the TODO contained within to properly mock the neutron API.

Change-Id: Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is

commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)

commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 10:42:51.000000000', 'message': "[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
"}]
commit_message:
[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071

commit_message:
Delete the ca-rotate api-ref
'ca-rotate' hasn't been supported, 'ERROR: 'rotate_ca_certificate'
is not supported by this driver (HTTP 400)' will be returned.
So, I think we should supply the api after it's realization.

Change-Id: I698b9df3876dd9fa4e1685973762d92ec3a5f7ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-31 10:46:57.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Return default quota from API

Currently the dashboard and magnum clients are unable to get the default
quota of a project, if a project does not have a quota set. This is due
to the API returning a QuotaNotFound exception, rather than falling back
to the default quota.

The result is that dashboard is not displaying quotas correctly. It also
means users are not able to see their default quota.

This patch updates the API by returning the default quota instead of a
QuotaNotFound exception. This makes magnum behave similarly to how other
projects like designate handles quota.

Story: 2006307
Task: 36029
Change-Id: I1b278d221d0f15d92d67869cd3ac897d041eaf90

commit_message:
Return default quota from API

Currently the dashboard and magnum clients are unable to get the default
quota of a project, if a project does not have a quota set. This is due
to the API returning a QuotaNotFound exception, rather than falling back
to the default quota.

The result is that dashboard is not displaying quotas correctly. It also
means users are not able to see their default quota.

This patch updates the API by returning the default quota instead of a
QuotaNotFound exception. This makes magnum behave similarly to how other
projects like designate handles quota.

Story: 2006307
Task: 36029
Change-Id: I1b278d221d0f15d92d67869cd3ac897d041eaf90

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ifdfec4051b03395457535842928b9ebb44cfe121
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2019-09-26 15:28:57.000000000', 'message': "Extend timeout for database migration tests

Database migration tests (specifically test_walk_versions
and test_mysql_innodb) are failing due to multiple reasons
from oslo.db side mentioned in the code comments.
Increasing the timeout will allow the tests to execute
successfully on slower nodes.
This solution is adopted from manila [1] and also implemented
in neutron [2] for the same and hopefully they're not facing the
issue currently.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291397/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I31bdcfc12e3b8b54d5b5a6664f88df3b7dcd4fc0
(cherry picked from commit ad0b6691e2a85d4b36978d02953dca2c289a82e6)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py
"}]
commit_message:
Extend timeout for database migration tests

Database migration tests (specifically test_walk_versions
and test_mysql_innodb) are failing due to multiple reasons
from oslo.db side mentioned in the code comments.
Increasing the timeout will allow the tests to execute
successfully on slower nodes.
This solution is adopted from manila [1] and also implemented
in neutron [2] for the same and hopefully they're not facing the
issue currently.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291397/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I31bdcfc12e3b8b54d5b5a6664f88df3b7dcd4fc0
(cherry picked from commit ad0b6691e2a85d4b36978d02953dca2c289a82e6)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py

commit_message:
Tests: Fix up migrate notify tests

Search for notify calls in a way that ignores extra
notifications.

Remove mock_notify.assert_not_called()

Partial-Bug: #1803648

Change-Id: I5e0823453cbadbd7ab1dcaa3e651769629eb409e
(cherry picked from commit 6f9135b6a48d7e900e8b33adf1e69c2463eac852)
(cherry picked from commit 96c3892bb103b7318ed650da089c7da412e61116)

commit_message:
Added changes to avoid building of deploy iso when provided

This commit adds change in ironic devstack plugin to avoid
deploy iso image from getting created when 'IRONIC_DEPLOY_ISO_REQUIRED'
is true and deploy iso is provided.

Change-Id: Ie7b417001687c19aed001e74f5c40dfd0ddde5cc
Closes-bug: #1680763
